Introducing  

 

In 2020....

 

 

In 2020, we embraced a new norm, where donning of face masks have become a part of every day living.  With many mask types on the market, it immediately became clear to us that there is a need to combat the biggest problems that arise from such products
column2:
their single-use, which is bad for the environment, and discomfort, which is due to poor breathability or design. Invisible to many, is also the potential low filtration performance.  

 

That’s why for the past half a year,  we have intensified our research and development to deliver to you. Our ideal reusable super mask, a face mask that checks all of the boxes on Safety, Security and Comfort.

 

 Essential Features Summarized 

 

Comparison across different types of masks: 

 

One piece of CORI Super Recharge 96 can be re-used up to 60 times, which displaces 60 pieces of disposables. In a single year, one would expect to use at most 6 pieces of CORI Super Recharge 96, which would reduce the amount of used disposable masks significantly (ranging from 720 to 1000 pieces per annum)

 

  

 

Being ultra light and compact, the CORI Super Recharge 96 can be kept in different discrete locations for better preparedness, especially when there are mask shortages on the market.

 

 

 

 

The Super Recharge 96 is a reusable mask capable of filtering out more than 96% of 0.3 micron sized particles, which has been independently tested at an accredited lab. (N95 Masks generally filter out >
column3:
95% of 0.3um). This filtration performance can be retained up to 60 washes without deterioration, just requiring a simple rubbing procedure to the mask to recharge its filtration layers.

After each cycle of washing and drying, rub the CORI Super Recharge 96 between your palm 5-10 times as shown to restore its filtration efficiency. 

 

 

Be Amazed by its... 

 

 

 

The most important aspect of the CORI Super Recharge 96 that we had engineered for, is its superb breathability with its excellent filtration properties. In comparison to a diverse range of disposable or reusable masks tested, the CORI Super Recharge 96 presents the lowest breathing resistance. This is achieved by careful selection of the filtration layers that combine both mechanical and electrostatic filtration properties.

 

The Science of Tribo-Electric Filtration with Superior Breathability

 

 

 

In order to achieve the best breathability with ultra high filtration performance, a sequential filtration array was designed with the use of specially selected materials. The outermost layer, a biocompatible reticulated polyurethane foam serves as a Particle De-accelerator, slowing down particles with its microcellular channels that resemble a maze of pathways, achieving macro-filtration of larger particles between PM2.5 to PM10.   

 

Smaller particles that are not trapped by the foam, are slowed, and are trapped by either the hydrophobic non-woven mechanical/electrostatic filter (PM2.5 to PM0.3), and the innermost tribo-electric electrostatic filter (PM0.3) with a combined efficiency of over 96%. 

 

The two filter layers can be rubbed against each other to recharge the electrostatic filtration properties of the layers back to a very high performance, which is why we decided to call this product the SUPER RECHARGE 96. 

 

 

Behold its..

 

 

Using premium materials available, from the ultra soft biocompatible microcellular polyurethane foam, to the skin friendly and adjustable soft silicone rubber straps, coupled with the unique designed C3Ratio™, the CORI Super Recharge 96 is engineered for maximal comfort, suitable for everyday usage and activities.

 

 

To achieve odour control and cleanliness, we utilised the latest gold/silver technologies from FUZE Biotech. FUZE is a permanent, chemical-free technology that can be applied to any surface or textile to prevent and protect against odour. 

 

Listen to its..

\

 

 

Speech clarity is one of the most important things in communication especially when we have to be masked up. Miscommunication leads to many undesirable outcomes, wrongly communicated messages, hurt feelings, broken down collaborations etc. Fret not, when the Super Recharge 96 allows you to speak with superb clarity with minimal muffling. 

 

 

 

With adjustable straps and buckles on the Super Recharge 96, there is little to worry about nose to ear distances measurements at all. In order to have the best fit and comfort with our mask, our mask is designed to form a comfortable cup that fits over your nose and mouth for most common face sizes with a nose to chin measurement between 8.5cm (min) to 13cm (max). If you can use a regular sized surgical mask or a regular N95 mask, this mask should fit you all right, with significantly better comfort.

 

Enjoy its.. 

 

 

1. Wash the mask gently either in running water or in a basin with your favourite cleansing or disinfectant soap. 

2. Press the mask in between a towel to squeeze out excess water. We do not recommend wringing. Pressing the mask dry between a towel or piece of cloth will help extend the reusability and life of the mask. 

3. Hang to dry

4. When Dry, rub 10x to recharge its high filtration performance. 

 

TESTING &
column4:
REGULATORY DETAILS

 

The materials - The Polyurethane foam that is in contact with users has been tested to ISO10993 Standards for Biocompatibility by GLR Laboratories, a GLP Accredited Laboratory. The filtration Media within the foam has also been tested by independent 3rd Party GLP Lab in Singapore, TUV-SUD. 

 

 

Update: 18th December 2020

In-House Testing - In order to facilitate fast R&
column5:
D, we procured a PFE Tester of validated design earlier this year. The PFE Tester meets many reference standards. It gives both the particle filtration efficiency for trapping of particles and also the differential pressure readings for breathability. 

 

Regulatory - The CORI Super Recharge 96 has not under gone any regulatory approval processes, but the team is in the midst of preparing samples for CE Mark testing, under EN149 / similar standards. 

The CORI Team started their design and development for the project in early February 2020, and achieved the final prototype in September 2020. The team went on to file for a patent for the mask design and it is currently patent pending. In December 2020, the team launched a successful Kickstarter campaign and was more than 200% funded. The funding raised on Kickstarter went towards the making of mass production tooling that allowed us to cost effectively manufacture the CORI Super Recharge 96. Following the huge success on Kickstarter, the team decided to bring the mask to Indiegogo to meet the needs of those who have missed out on our Kickstarter round.

 

 

From the creators of CORI Travel Pillow &
column6:
SuperTee...

 

 

Chief Project Coordinator - Jonita C. 

Lead Scientist - Dr Wes Chia.

Design, Development and Engineering Team - Jonathan Xiao, Eugene O, Sherman C, Christopher Y, Khoo BL, Liu Yong. 

Logistics and Fulfilment - Shirley N. 

 

We are a youthful team of scientists, designers and engineers with a strong passion to deliver to you some of the best products of its kind, and have done so over the years. 

This is CORI's 4th Indiegogo Campaign, after three previous campaigns of which we have successfully funded and fulfilled.

Invisible to many, is also the potential low filtration performance.   That’s why for the past half a year,  we have intensified our research and development to deliver to you. column1: The Trident Automatic: The New Luxury Diving Watch by NOVE
Continuing our line of beautiful Swiss-made hand-crafted timepieces, NOVE is launching our first automatic wristwatch, the new TRIDENT R150, right here on Indiegogo.
The TRIDENT AUTOMATIC will launch as a timed exclusive for Indiegogo, with worldwide shipping for backers by April 2021.
The new TRIDENT AUTOMATIC features a beautifully sleek redesign of our already popular Trident line of watches, built in an ultra-slim 13.05mm case with up to 200m of water resistance.
Ingeniously designed and masterfully engineered to ensure comfort on your wrist and performance in the water, the new TRIDENT AUTOMATIC is the automatic watch NOVE fans have been waiting for.
Made with a Swiss-made Automatic R150 movement, we carefully designed every piece of the TRIDENT AUTOMATIC to fit perfectly into our slim Trident case, without increasing its size.

The updated dial and case is now set with Double Curved Sapphire, creating high visibility and durability that is equivalent to its stunning look. We’ve also updated the dial itself, using the highest grade of Tahitian Mother of Pearl, which can take up to two years to mature and obtain from an oyster shell. This beautifully reflective material was carefully manufactured and quality controlled to best suit our standards of luxury, durability, and functionality.

Thanks to NOVE’s experienced team of engineers and the craftsmanship Swiss-design is known for, we are proud to say that the NOVE TRIDENT AUTOMATIC uses only the finest luxury materials. This new innovative design along with the high quality construction NOVE is known for lends itself to a truly one-of-a-kind automatic wristwatch.
The TRIDENT AUTOMATIC watch maintains all the great features our Trident line of watches are known for, while updating the design to improve look, quality, and function.

Inspired by Poseidon, the King of the Sea, and his divine trident attribute, the TRIDENT AUTOMATIC watch was built with strong water resistance in mind. Crafted specifically for diving, this new piece by NOVE is a powerful marriage of design and engineering, resilient to heavy underwater pressures thanks to its water-resistant ability for up to 200 meters.
Its ultra-slim construction feels light and comfortable both in and out of water, while maintaining the luxurious look of finely made Swiss-based timepieces.

Featuring Super Luminous technology on the watch index and hands, the TRIDENT AUTOMATIC produces a vibrant glow for easy visibility in the dark. Perfect for deep sea diving, the luminescent coating supports easy time-telling, anytime and anywhere.
Also new to our Trident series of watches, the TRIDENT AUTOMATIC features a new sweep second hand for divers and users who require time precision down to the second.
Ultra-Slim Design - Comfortable to Wear, No Shortcuts on Performance

The world’s slimmest luxury diving watch, the TRIDENT AUTOMATIC is built to be just as comfortable as it is durable and functional. The uniquely milled and thin Double Curved Sapphire crystal on the dial maximizes available space, leaving proper room for the watch hands and movement rotor to function while still allowing the Trident to retain its ultra-thin design.
NOVE engineers pushed the boundaries of design to achieve precision in the smallest space, showing the might of Poseidon in this reinvention of the Swiss-made dive watch.
Founded in 2015, NOVE is reinventing the trade of timepiece design through innovation and individuality.

With an eye on the future and reverence towards the history of craftsmanship Switzerland is known for, our mission is to create beautiful watches that are durable, extraordinary, and functional, but also unbound to any one specific look or lifestyle.
After you confirm your reward, you will receive an email with instructions on how to secure your exact watch(es).

Founding NOVE in 2015, Tiffany Meerovitsch continues the movement of creating beautiful handcrafted timepieces as art. Discover more about Tiffany and the inspiration that drives NOVE with this video.
As lovers of the ocean and in keeping our environment clean, NOVE is donating a percentage of its proceeds to a nonprofit organization supporting Citizens of the Great Barrier Reef.

NOVE's commitment to quality and craftsmanship is shown in every single one of our timepieces. Built with complete reverence to the brand of quality Swiss-made watches are known for, NOVE's designs are durable and built to last.
As lovers of the ocean and in keeping our environment clean, NOVE is donating a percentage of its proceeds to a nonprofit organization supporting Citizens of the Great Barrier Reef.

Sipping cocktails by the side of the pool or lounging out reading your favourite book on the beach may seem like a distant memory right now, but with vaccine progress and lockdowns easing, it’s time to start thinking about ditching those sweatpants for swim shorts.

If you’re the kind of guy that has worn the same beaten swim shorts for years, baggy and ill-fitting, or worse, still wear the swim shorts you panic bought after forgetting to pack your own on holiday (don’t worry, we’ve been there…), read on my friend, as Borraco has got you covered this summer.

Borraco swimwear has been created to meet the needs of today's gentlemen beachgoers, expertly tailored, with unique designs, quick-dry technology, and a zip-back pocket – Borraco swimwear has been designed so that they can effortlessly take you from the beach to the bar.

In the 16th Century, Emperor Charles V of Italy ordered the construction of a system of watchtowers that ran the length of the Puglia coastline, built to protect Italy from invasion. These magnificent towers still stand today, but the sea and beaches they overlook face a different challenge and one of the world’s greatest environmental catastrophes – plastic pollution.

It was under one such tower, named ‘Borraco’, where the founders, volunteering to clean the beach from plastic waste, decided they wanted to build a sustainable and eco-friendly swimwear brand that could in some way contribute to reducing the plastic that blights our planet.  Being an Italian brand, we take quality and creative design seriously, and it’s these two values that underline our brand value – ‘Italian style inspires us, Sustainability defines us’.

Our men's swim shorts are manufactured using fabric made from 100% recycled post-consumer plastic bottles. It’s our mission to always provide our customers with unique, modern and luxurious clothing in the most eco-friendly and sustainable way possible.
Each pair of Borraco swims shorts are made of the equivalent of 6 recycled plastic bottles
Each design has been hand-drawn by a local Italian artist (Sofia Franciosini)
column2:
at Borraco we don’t believe in copy-paste designs, with every short created unique to the brand. 

 

Choosing your design

In honour of our brand heritage, we are launching on Indiegogo with our Puglia-inspired collection, taking the best and most unique aspects of Puglia and reinventing these into our stylish and one-of-a-kind designs. When you select your perk, you will be able to choose from the designs below:

 

 

Choosing your size 

For reference, all the models used in our marketing material wear a size Medium. Borraco swimwear is tailored to have a modern cut and fit, however, if you prefer a bit more give in your swim shorts we suggest ordering a size up
column3:
if in doubt please use the size chart as a guide to finding your size. The model in the video below is 5'11 (180cm) and has a 32 inch (81cm) waist, he is wearing our #fichi design in size medium.

At Borraco we take sustainability seriously, to demonstrate this commitment we have been awarded pending status by B-Corporation, with the view to becoming fully qualified once we have been in operations for more than 12 months.

Certified B Corps are a new kind of business that balances purpose and profit. They are legally required to consider the impact of their decisions on their workers, customers, suppliers, community, and the environment.
column4:
>                                             

 

The fabric used to make Borraco swimwear is 100% recycled from post-consumer plastic bottles.  Manufactured in Italy, NewLife™ fabric uses a mechanical process for transforming plastic bottles into a polymer, meaning no harmful environmental chemicals are used during the process. 

Thanks to fewer processing stages, less energy is consumed for manufacturing, resulting in a considerable reduction in carbon emissions compared with virgin polyester (-32%), as well as using less water and electricity.

The fabric used for Borraco swimwear is certified Oekotek, holds Global Recycled Standard status and is recognised by the Italian ICEA for ethical practices and environmental respect.

At Borraco we are committed to ensuring our swimwear is sustainably and ethically made, has multiple features, and comes at a cost that is far more accessible than other well-known Luxury swimwear brands.

We have worked tirelessly over the last 2-years to build the perfect pair of swim shorts, selecting the most ethical manufacturers and materials, as well as testing and refining multiple designs, all done so that we can be confident we will be providing you with one of the best swim shorts available on the market today. Simply put, by backing this project, you will help us finance the minimum order quantity required to bring Borraco swimwear into production.

The hardest challenge we have faced was finding the right manufacturer for our swim shorts, after developing and producing several different prototypes with different manufacturers (over 18 months), we found the perfect manufacturer in Portugal that develops swimwear for several high-end and well-known swimwear brands. We also searched high and low for fabric that could satisfy our standards of being sustainable, whilst simultaneously being comfortable and durable. We have tried to minimise Indiegogo customer risk by developing a strong relationship with our manufacturer, where we hope to have the ability to ship out our shorts as quickly as possible, without sacrificing the quality of the product. Everything is set to go, we just need your help to launch Borraco.

 

Want to find out a little more about Borraco, stay up to date on future products, or ask us questions direct? Follow us below:

Instagram

Facebook

Website
column5:
>Meet the Team

column4: >Or if Facebook  or Instagram is more your kinda thing.
column7: >Team Timbuktu makes outdoors apparel that you actually want to wear, that doesn’t compromise on quality, and there’s no shortcuts by people or planet. Because we believe you shouldn't have to compromise on style, to adventure outdoors. And we operate in a way that we’d be proud to tell our grans about, which is the only way it should be.
column13: >Fashion is the second most polluting industry in the world, second only to oil.
column14: >The unsustainable use of non renewable resources and poor practices within supply chains have long lasting negative impacts on the makers and the environment. Factory employees commonly work in dangerous conditions that have lifelong health impacts.
column15: >Petrochemicals and toxic dyes are used to create synthetic fabrics that aren’t biodegradable, and untreated wastewater is flushed into rivers and waterways. The amount of energy and resources used to create apparel is almost inconceivable.
column16: >On top of this, people seem to think it’s acceptable to treat apparel like it’s disposable. In Australia we throw ½ a million tonnes of clothing into landfill every single year. It’s kind of crazy that something this bad is happening under our noses. This has to change.
column19: >Everyone holds purchasing power, and this holds more weight than you can imagine.
column20: >If you demand higher quality goods that are manufactured responsibly and aren’t devastating the environment, businesses will listen and change.
column21: >Stop buying cheap, mass-produced fast fashion and start supporting businesses doing good. Ask where your clothes came from, what they're made of and under what conditions they were manufactured in. You're entitled to this information and this needs to become more transparent within the industry.
column23: >Team Timbuktu creates responsibly manufactured high quality outdoors apparel from recycled materials. We know that you shouldn't have to compromise on quality, aesthetic, people or planet in order to create an epic product. We're super stringent about who we work with, what materials we use and have spent months ensuring our supply chain is top notch.
column25: >Our incredibly innovative fabric supplier creates fabrics made from recycled plastics. This fabric is called RPET (recycled polyethylene terephthalate) and is a more sustainable option, as it diverts plastics from landfill and uses 50% less energy to make than virgin polyester.
column26: >But it doesn't feel tough or scratchy like you'd imagine plastic would feel, it's super smooth, stretchy and comfortable. Want to know how on earth we can make fabric from plastic bottles?
column30: >Team Timbuktu partners with manufacturers committed to BSCI to protect our talented workers rights ensuring their health, safety and happiness. We will never cut corners in manufacturing as everyone has the right to be kept safe and healthy at work.
column31: >The Business Social Compliance Initiative (BSCI) helps companies to improve social compliance and supply chains, and protects workers’ rights. This includes no forced labour, no child labour, fair remuneration and OH&amp
column33: >Learn more: http://www.bsci-intl.org
column35: >Team Timbuktu is initially donating 20% of profits to help people and planet, because we'd be nothing without them and strongly believe in giving back to those who need it. We're a purpose led business that wants to be a champion for change and believe that all businesses have the capacity to make a difference
column36: >First up we’re supporting mental health through Waves of Wellness, a charity who are committed to changing lives and helping those with mental health challenges through surf therapy and education. They're an epic organisation who are helping reduce the stigma associated with mental health and are achieving incredible things. Learn more about their story and impact here.
column37: >We’re also supporting the conservation of our environment through the Foundation for National Parks &amp
column38: Wildlife (FNPW). We thought it was only fair to help protect the environment we fell in love with and are so dependent on. FNPW are an amazing organisation who invest in conservation projects to protect Australia’s fragile ecosystems and native species. Find out more about their mission and projects here.
column39: >Please note we will be donating 20% of profits from our launch next year, excluding funds raised from this crowdfunding campaign, due to the rules of the platform.
column42: >Nope. We can see why you might think that, but Team Timbuktu is about all things outdoors.
column43: >We’re starting small with our first production run but we'll be developing the range progressively as we can afford to do so to extensively cover more outdoor activities and all of the weather that gets thrown at us. Our vision is to one day make everything from hiking pants to puffer jackets, tents and sleeping bags so this is our first step on the way there.
column44: >Check out all the tech features we’ve included in our first run of apparel and why we’re so much more than just another f*cking legging brand.
column47: >This will sound crazy, but the majority of fashion 'raincoats' aren’t actually waterproof… they’re only water resistant. Our fabric is laminated, breathable and most importantly, waterproof. The fabric is rated 10K waterproof and 10K breathable. Essentially you can do all the outdoorsy activities in the pouring rain without getting sweaty or wet.
column50: >An amazing bunch of people (aka you) pledge support in order to make a new idea happen. For Team Timbuktu, it’s super early presales to fund our first production run.
column51: >By supporting Team Timbuktu at this early stage you’ll be the first to receive our product, receive discounts off RRP, help choose what prints go into production and you’ll have earned legend status for life.
column52: >But....the only problem is that crowdfunding is an all or nothing concept. If we don’t reach our goal, no funds are received. So pledge your support and tell your mates.
column53: >We can’t start Team Timbuktu without you.
column56: >You’re a champion, that’s what you are.
column57: >Check out the rewards you can scoop up for your early support.
column59: >P.S shipping Australia wide is $5. Over the ditch and further afar is $25.
column62: >As a crowdfunding supporter you get to vote what prints go into final production. Epic right?
column63: >At the end of our crowdfunding campaign you vote on your favourite prints from 20 choices, from there we’ll get back in contact with you and find out what exact print you’d like on your piece of Team Timbuktu apparel that will soon be a part of your floordrobe.
column64: >Here's just some of the selection that you'll be choosing from!
column68: >No seriously. We really should be selling our apparel for a whole lot more: there’s no shortcuts by people or planet, and all these tech features aren’t cheap. We're paying a premium for the best fabrics, to be made by the best manufacturers to create the best possible product. By being based online we can avoid the retail markup so we're still an accessible brand. We’re doing this because we believe it shouldn’t cost an arm and a leg to buy the best product and to support businesses doing good.
column70: >Our sizing runs from XS-XL because we believe everyone should be doing cool shit outdoors, no excuses. We are 110% happy to exchange sizing because sometimes you don’t get it quite right the first time, and who knows how much we’ll be eating over the holidays…
column71: >Team Timbuktu's sizing should be the same as what you normally wear, but if you want to double check, grab a tape measure. Please note that the sizing below is based off the circumference of your body and what size we'd recommend from there, and is not measurements of the garment.
column73: >*We only have a small sample set right now as samples are crazy expensive, so our imagery doesn't fully reflect our belief in diversity, but don't worry, it will when we launch next year.
column76: >Who knows? And unfortunately we won’t be trying.
column77: >We’ve got a never ending list of things we need to purchase and invest in first. We’ve spent thousands of dollars and almost a year of unpaid work to get to pre-production but we’ve run out of money. We need your help to get to the finish line and fund our first bulk production run.
column78: >Costs so far have included: sourcing fabrics, finding manufacturers, first samples, second samples, third samples, freight, website, setting up a company, and the list goes on. Not to mention the hundreds of hours spent on design, planning, liaising with manufacturers and a whole pile of stress for good measure. Setting up an apparel company takes serious cash dollars.
column79: >Have a geeze at why we need to raise $15,000 for our first production run.
column82: >This is the bit where we ask you to sit tight, because manufacturing takes time, especially when we’re using the best manufacturers and the best quality fabrics to ensure you get the best possible product.
column86: >Team Timbuktu was born out of the love of the outdoors and the frustration of only seeing ugly outdoors apparel.
column87: >The concept has been brewing for years, resurfacing whenever founder Rhianna would get out of Melbourne to explore. This started with hiking every trail within Wilsons Promontory National Park, which eventually lead to longer adventures. During a five-day solo hike in South America earlier this year (whilst wearing some really ugly gear) it was decided that Team Timbuktu would become a reality.
column89: >After completing her Bachelor's degree in fashion, Rhianna worked for a snowboarding apparel company learning the ins and outs of design and production before starting Team Timbuktu. Due to her years of experience already working within the industry she has a complex understanding of how the industry operates and the opportunities that exist for change. She's passionate about minimising her impact on the planet and spends any time she can outdoors, from hiking, camping, climbing, surfing, snowboarding, yoga and running, there's more than a few outdoorsy activities on high rotation. Team Timbuktu is a minimal risk project once funded due to Rhianna's prior work history and knowledge of the entire supply chain, she's previously worked with some of the manufacturers before and will be visiting everyone prior to production.
column92: >We've been overwhelmed by all of the love so far during the campaign from our supporters and also a few super friendly folks in the land of media. It means the world to us and improves our chance of getting funded when you share the Team Timbuktu story with your friends and we're so grateful for all the support so far!
column93: >Hooray! We're number one on Sporteluxe's '5 Eco Friendly Aussie Activewear Brands To Watch in 2018'!
column94: >Like the idea of exercising ethically? Have a squiz at our story on The Weekend Edition!
column95: >Got 2 mins spare for a read? Our article from The Daily Mail Australia delved deep into Team Timbuktu, our background and why we do what we do.
column96: >We are LOVING our writeup from our friends at <a href=""https://concreteplayground.com/melbourne/design-style/budding-aussie-fashion-label-turning-water-bottles-outdoor-apparel/?utm_content=buffer73ec2&amp
column99: utm_campaign=buffer"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Concrete Playground. ""Apologies, Kathmandu, you serve a purpose but there's a new queen on the block"". Check it out :)
column100: >Our mates over at We Are Explorers were ever so kind to write about Team Timbuktu and our crowdfunding campaign so jump over there to read the full article!
column101: >Check out our feature on The Urban List , who show the very best of what's happening around the city right now. ""...looks like Lululemon and Gorman created an adventuresome baby"". We're honoured they put us on a pedestal and ranked us so highly with other ethically minded sustainable companies!
column102: >If you'd like to hear more about the vision of Team Timbuktu, the problems with the fashion industry at the present and Rhianna's background have a listen to our podcast from all the way over in the States.
column103: >We've also been thrown some old fashioned social media love  by a bunch of epic ethically minded brands including The Seek Society, Fairtees, Salt Gypsy and Ethical Index :)
column104: >We'd love to spread the word about sustainable fashion to as many eyes and ears as possible so please contact Rhianna for a media kit.
column107: >Thank you so much for taking the time to read our story and we'd be so appreciative if you followed our journey and kept updated with our progress on Instagram and Facebook .
column108: >If you've got any questions, feedback or want to tell us what you ate for breakfast holla at us here hello@teamtimbuktu.com
column109: >Or if you're reading this post crowdfunding epic job on making it this far you legend!
column110: >Continue the love and check out our website for real :)
column111: >Special thanks to an amazing bunch of legends to which this wouldn’t have been possible without their help. Tess, Amanda, Kadence, Ben, Chanel, Bec, Taylah, Asher and a few other ducks are superstars worthy of a high five if you're ever lucky enough to bump into them.
column112: >We would honestly be over the moon if you supported Team Timbuktu today because we really need your help to make a difference. By purchasing one of the first pieces through discounted presales, with the power to choose what prints make it through to production and the warm fuzzies knowing you're supporting a small business trying to make a difference. And because how much of your wardrobe is made from recycled plastic bottles?

","Check out our website!Or if Facebook  or Instagram is more your kinda thing.Team Timbuktu makes outdoors apparel that you actually want to wear, that doesn’t compromise on quality, and there’s no shortcuts by people or planet. In Australia we throw ½ a million tonnes of clothing into landfill every single year. It’s kind of crazy that something this bad is happening under our noses. We're super stringent about who we work with, what materials we use and have spent months ensuring our supply chain is top notch.Our incredibly innovative fabric supplier creates fabrics made from recycled plastics. This fabric is called RPET (recycled polyethylene terephthalate) and is a more sustainable option, as it diverts plastics from landfill and uses 50% less energy to make than virgin polyester.But it doesn't feel tough or scratchy like you'd imagine plastic would feel, it's super smooth, stretchy and comfortable. Want to know how on earth we can make fabric from plastic bottles?Team Timbuktu partners with manufacturers committed to BSCI to protect our talented workers rights ensuring their health, safety and happiness. Our vision is to one day make everything from hiking pants to puffer jackets, tents and sleeping bags so this is our first step on the way there. Check out all the tech features we’ve included in our first run of apparel and why we’re so much more than just another f*cking legging brand.This will sound crazy, but the majority of fashion 'raincoats' aren’t actually waterproof… they’re only water resistant. Our fabric is laminated, breathable and most importantly, waterproof. The fabric is rated 10K waterproof and 10K breathable. Essentially you can do all the outdoorsy activities in the pouring rain without getting sweaty or wet.An amazing bunch of people (aka you) pledge support in order to make a new idea happen. For Team Timbuktu, it’s super early presales to fund our first production run.By supporting Team Timbuktu at this early stage you’ll be the first to receive our product, receive discounts off RRP, help choose what prints go into production and you’ll have earned legend status for life.But....the only problem is that crowdfunding is an all or nothing concept. Over the ditch and further afar is $25.As a crowdfunding supporter you get to vote what prints go into final production. Epic right?At the end of our crowdfunding campaign you vote on your favourite prints from 20 choices, from there we’ll get back in contact with you and find out what exact print you’d like on your piece of Team Timbuktu apparel that will soon be a part of your floordrobe. Here's just some of the selection that you'll be choosing from!No seriously. We really should be selling our apparel for a whole lot more: there’s no shortcuts by people or planet, and all these tech features aren’t cheap. We're paying a premium for the best fabrics, to be made by the best manufacturers to create the best possible product. By being based online we can avoid the retail markup so we're still an accessible brand. column1: We have come a long way since we sold our first bag online 3 years ago!
1) Set up our first permanent shop in Melbourne, Australia. We just celebrated our 6 month Anniversary of shop success and community building locally and globally.

2) Through our dedication to minimising harm to our beautiful planet, we have managed to up-cycle 10 tonnes of fashion and textile waste before they hit landfill. All our products are made from clothing and textile waste, that have either been donated or discarded. This results in some of the most unique, often one-of-a-kind products, that are also durable, affordable, and beautifully and specially different. Like our supporters and customers.
3) Through our partnership with the charity BabyTree Projects we have funded their Solar Project program and 3,000 places for children to study English in the Sophia Saly School.

4) We have built BeeKeeper's Imaginarium. Which is what we call our production house in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. It is where we create all our beautiful products. We began with one woman, one sewing machine, one room and now we have grown to 13 people, paid higher than the living wage and under ethical conditions.

5) But my greatest achievement to date, is learning to accept the loss of my sister, Sophia Saly. Who lives on in my heart. It is incredible that I need to look no further than my own skin to find all the inspiration I need to help change the world for the better. One promise kept.
But the story is not over yet, we need to do more...and we need your help...
• To fully complete our Imaginarium by improving our facilities, investing in industrial machines and more sewing machines, create 5 more jobs and add a clothing team.

• To properly set-up our Permanent Shop in Brunswick Street. We hope to add some special fit-outs and create an audio tour for people, that will make the BeeKeeper Shop experience even more special :) Also, create a very planty and jungly co-working space upstairs to help other dreamers, chase their dreams.
• To continue to reduce fashion waste and support children's access to quality education in rural Cambodia.

• And last but not least, to ""To Release the Lights"" a special project, that through movement and touch will ignite a light show that will illuminate the shop in hues of purple and orange. My sister's colours and a secret nod to her and to celebrate her contribution to the world.
• Make a pledge for one of our amazing perks today :). This not only helps us reach our targets, but also contributes to a cleaner and fairer world.
• Share this page, our video, our story on social media. And tell your family and friends about us through email or in your next conversation (haha).
• Join our growing community by following us on instagram, friending us on facebook,  and joining our
What our amazing customers and supporters have been saying about:

""I saw a backpack on your FB page which I loved - an exchange of messages and emails and now the backpack is mine. Thank you for your attention to detail and quality service and product! Love it more in the flesh!!!"" - Hillary Makepeace

""Finally made my way to Beekeeper Parade today (after a long time drooling over my computer at all of the wonderful products). I was blessed to meet Koky in the store and had a lovely chat with him whilst choosing may goodies. A weekender, laptop cover, purse, coin purse and phone/passport much later, I have to say, not only are all of these products a delight to the eye, they are practical and so well made, add to that the fact they are ethically made, upcylced fabric and supporting a wonderful cause, what is there not to love about this business and Koky???"" - Anita Anderson
Our first Crowdfunding video created three years ago!

""Koky is a true inspiration and has become a friend and mentor to my young son who met him when Koky spoke at his school. His product is not only well made, useful and stylish. It is made sustainably and assists people in the best ways, from the industry that it creates, to the educational funding it provides. Despite many challenges and tragedies, Koky continually gives back in many ways."" - Anne-Maree Palmieri

""I got my pouch in the mail today after a wonderful shopping process in which I was fully informed at every step. 
It is a thing of beauty, well made and big enough to fit all the flotsam and jetsam of my handbag in one handy to reach spot.
The handwritten thank you note from Koky just topped off an experience I plan on repeating any time I need a new bag of any sort.
Thanks guys, so pleased to have such a lovely way of doing some good for others."" - Cherie Guest
""A must to check out. Awesome products with a great story behind it."" - Emily Robinson

""What an amazing individual Koky is! I met him and heard his story yesterday and walked out with two gorgeous bags. The bags are well constructed with thoughtful pockets but the real plus is the upcycling and the giving back to Cambodian society. Absolute kudos to Koky, what a wonderful tribute to his sister’s memory. X""  Leeanne Foster

""I honestly can’t recommend highly enough! I did the workshop and had a great time, and my backpack is fabulous. I also made a purse for my Mum for Christmas which is just gorgeous. Pretty sure I will be doing another workshop ... I need a new purse, and have my eye on an overnight bag ..."" - Mandy Gray

""I love amazing new backpack!! It's super strong and sturdy and so well made. I was so impressed it arrived (super quick!) in upcycled reusable packaging too! Well done Koky. You are really doing everything you can to build an ethical, social and environmentally friendly business. So happy to support it. Thank you!"" - Zoe Cunliffe-Jones

""Absolutely love everything about my new bag, my tablet pouch and my pencil case! The quality is above and beyond, so the attention to detail. What an awesome thing, to be able to get something beautiful and do something beautiful at the same time! Bliss"" - Izzy Evans
""It was the highlight of my day meeting Koky and chatting to him about how Beekeeper came about and how it operates. Restored my faith in humankind."" - Aurora Tonini

column2: >EACH INDIVIDUAL BEEKEEPER PRODUCT IS UNIQUE, WE USE HIGH QUALITY UP-CYCLED TEXTILE AND FASHION WASTE AND TRANSFORM THEM INTO PRODUCTS THAT HELP CLEAN UP THE PLNET, FUND ETHICAL JOBS DURING PRODUCTION AND SUPPORT CHILDREN'S ACCESS TO QUALITY EDUCATION IN RURAL CAMBODIA.

column1: ALL BeeKeeper Parade products will tackle the world’s massive textiles waste issues head on whilst giving children a rich future of quality education through our partnership with the charity BabyTree Projects.
BeeKeeper Parade sources high quality discarded clothing and textile and transforms the material into durable, functional and eco-friendly products before it reaches landfill.
We are now chasing down our next target of unlocking our GIVE US WINGS Milestone, which is the $50,000 mark.

We thought we should begin our clothing range with an item that most of us wears on a daily basis. And it will be a good product to test and train our clothing team. Before we get onto more complicated things.
Here are some of the coolest things about our t-shirts:

column2: >""For every t-shirt you buy, a student in our schools will get one too."" - Wow and amazing!
>""They help reduce fashion and textile waste.""

column1: - These are just renderings of t-shirts and don't represent the true colour of the fabric choices that will become available.
- Once you have pledged we will email you with four different design, colour and size options.
- They will be available in women's, men's and children's cut.
- The expected delivery date for our t-shirts is set at November 2018.
- You may pledge for 1, 2, 3, the whole set or, pledge for an entire school to receive one, including teachers :)
WE FINALLY HAVE PICTURES OF YOUR BUMBAG OPTIONS!

Please see just some of the option below. Once the bumbag perk is chosen we will email you your choice of options. We have over 12 different patterns and colours to choose from. Once you decide, we will pack and post straight-away :)
NEW: Our beautiful blankets have  arrived and they will keep you warm this winter on the outside and on the inside. Here are some reasons why:
* They are up-cycled from raw cotton skeins.
* They are hand-dipped in natural dyes to create an ombré effect.
* They are woven by a family of weavers, whose skills are passed down from generation to generation.
* Woven on looms as old as family tradition.
PLUS, they also clean up our planet, supports education in rural Cambodia and may help us to create more jobs.
Some beautiful backpacks that have just become available:
Some stunning weekenders that have become available:
Our products are ready to be shipped out straight away.
When our products features in Melbourne Spring Fashion Week 2015:
Once in a life time Cambodia tour

Join us on a once in a lifetime opportunity to explore my family history and the evolution of Beekeeper Parade. Immerse yourself in a unique experience that is being offered for the first and probably only time. You will also gain direct insights into how Beekeeper Parade is cleaning up the planet and creating employment and educational opportunities.

 

Day 1 Arrival Dinner – Lets share a delicious Cambodian dinner together.

 

Day 2 Prison, School Tour and Dinner – Today will explore where it all started for me. We will visit the prison that I was born in. We will visit the first school that Sophia and I built. You will see firsthand how some of the profits from Beekeeper sales support student education. We will end the day with a relaxing dinner at a local Siem Reap restaurant.

 

Day 3 Travel to Phnom Penh and visit the Killing Fields – This morning we will take a one hour flight to Phnom Penh. After some free time, we will visit the Killing Fields on the outskirts of Phnom Penh to deepen our understanding of the Khmer Rouge period.

 

Day 4 Imaginarium and Dinner – Today we visit the Imaginarium where our wonderful craftspeople make Beekeeper Parade products. You will have the opportunity to do a custom workshop where you will design your own bag or purse. This will be shipped to you after the tour. In the evening we will share a meal together at a local Khmer restaurant.

 

Day 5 Kep - This morning we will travel to Kep by car (3 hours). You will have free time to enjoy the local resort and township.

 

Day 6 Sophia Saly School, Secret Beach and Final Dinner – Today you will enjoy a special tour of the Sophia Saly School that Sophia and I built. Following on we will meet Grandma Black and her neighbours when we visit Secret Beach. You will get a real sense of what it is like to live in a sleepy seaside town in Cambodia. In the evening we will share our final meal together and reflect on our journey together.
Day 7 Tour Ends – Today it’s time to reflect and say goodbye. But we will keep in touch. X
PLEASE NOTE: Included in the tour is your very own personalised and customised:
* Inside your backpack will be a letter from the founder, a map or your adventure and a diary to record your favourite moments and experience.
* The tour group will share in the use of a polaroid camera to capture instant moments to help you remember your time in this tour of a life time.
We have come a long way since we sold our first bag online 3 years ago!
1) Set up our first permanent shop in Melbourne, Australia. We just celebrated our 6 month Anniversary of shop success and community building locally and globally.

2) Through our dedication to minimising harm to our beautiful planet, we have managed to up-cycle 10 tonnes of fashion and textile waste before they hit landfill. All our products are made from clothing and textile waste, that have either been donated or discarded. This results in some of the most unique, often one-of-a-kind products, that are also durable, affordable, and beautifully and specially different. Like our supporters and customers.
3) Through our partnership with the charity BabyTree Projects we have funded their Solar Project program and 3,000 places for children to study English in the Sophia Saly School.

4) We have built BeeKeeper's Imaginarium. Which is what we call our production house in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. It is where we create all our beautiful products. We began with one woman, one sewing machine, one room and now we have grown to 13 people, paid higher than the living wage and under ethical conditions.

5) But my greatest achievement to date, is learning to accept the loss of my sister, Sophia Saly. Who lives on in my heart. It is incredible that I need to look no further than my own skin to find all the inspiration I need to help change the world for the better. One promise kept.
But the story is not over yet, we need to do more...and we need your help...
To fully complete our Imaginarium by improving our facilities, investing in industrial machines and more sewing machines, create 5 more jobs and add a clothing team.

To properly set-up our Permanent Shop in Brunswick Street. We hope to add some special fit-outs and create an audio tour for people, that will make the BeeKeeper Shop experience even more special :) Also, create a very planty and jungly co-working space upstairs to help other dreamers, chase their dreams.
To continue to reduce fashion waste and support children's access to quality education in rural Cambodia.

And last but not least, to ""To Release the Lights"" a special project, that through movement and touch will ignite a light show that will illuminate the shop in hues of purple and orange. My sister's colours and a secret nod to her and to celebrate her contribution to the world.
HOW YOU CAN HELP MAKE CHANGE :)
Make a pledge for one of our amazing perks today :). This not only helps us reach our targets, but also contributes to a cleaner and fairer world.
Share this page, our video, our story on social media. And tell your family and friends about us through email or in your next conversation (haha).
Join our growing community by following us on instagram, friending us on facebook,  and joining our email list.
What our amazing customers and supporters have been saying about:

I saw a backpack on your FB page which I loved - an exchange of messages and emails and now the backpack is mine. Thank you for your attention to detail and quality service and product! Love it more in the flesh!!!"" - Hillary Makepeace

Finally made my way to Beekeeper Parade today (after a long time drooling over my computer at all of the wonderful products). I was blessed to meet Koky in the store and had a lovely chat with him whilst choosing may goodies. A weekender, laptop cover, purse, coin purse and phone/passport much later, I have to say, not only are all of these products a delight to the eye, they are practical and so well made, add to that the fact they are ethically made, upcylced fabric and supporting a wonderful cause, what is there not to love about this business and Koky???"" - Anita Anderson
Our first Crowdfunding video created three years ago!

Koky is a true inspiration and has become a friend and mentor to my young son who met him when Koky spoke at his school. His product is not only well made, useful and stylish. It is made sustainably and assists people in the best ways, from the industry that it creates, to the educational funding it provides. Despite many challenges and tragedies, Koky continually gives back in many ways."" - Anne-Maree Palmieri

I got my pouch in the mail today after a wonderful shopping process in which I was fully informed at every step. It is a thing of beauty, well made and big enough to fit all the flotsam and jetsam of my handbag in one handy to reach spot.The handwritten thank you note from Koky just topped off an experience I plan on repeating any time I need a new bag of any sort.Thanks guys, so pleased to have such a lovely way of doing some good for others."" - Cherie Guest
A must to check out. Awesome products with a great story behind it."" - Emily Robinson

What an amazing individual Koky is! I met him and heard his story yesterday and walked out with two gorgeous bags. The bags are well constructed with thoughtful pockets but the real plus is the upcycling and the giving back to Cambodian society. Absolute kudos to Koky, what a wonderful tribute to his sister’s memory. X""  Leeanne Foster

I honestly can’t recommend highly enough! I did the workshop and had a great time, and my backpack is fabulous. I also made a purse for my Mum for Christmas which is just gorgeous. Pretty sure I will be doing another workshop ... I need a new purse, and have my eye on an overnight bag ..."" - Mandy Gray

I love amazing new backpack!! It's super strong and sturdy and so well made. I was so impressed it arrived (super quick!) in upcycled reusable packaging too! Well done Koky. You are really doing everything you can to build an ethical, social and environmentally friendly business. So happy to support it. Thank you!"" - Zoe Cunliffe-Jones

Absolutely love everything about my new bag, my tablet pouch and my pencil case! The quality is above and beyond, so the attention to detail. What an awesome thing, to be able to get something beautiful and do something beautiful at the same time! Bliss"" - Izzy Evans
It was the highlight of my day meeting Koky and chatting to him about how Beekeeper came about and how it operates. Restored my faith in humankind."" - Aurora Tonini

EACH INDIVIDUAL BEEKEEPER PRODUCT IS UNIQUE, WE USE HIGH QUALITY UP-CYCLED TEXTILE AND FASHION WASTE AND TRANSFORM THEM INTO PRODUCTS THAT HELP CLEAN UP THE PLNET, FUND ETHICAL JOBS DURING PRODUCTION AND SUPPORT CHILDREN'S ACCESS TO QUALITY EDUCATION IN RURAL CAMBODIA.

ALL BeeKeeper Parade products will tackle the world’s massive textiles waste issues head on whilst giving children a rich future of quality education through our partnership with the charity BabyTree Projects.
BeeKeeper Parade sources high quality discarded clothing and textile and transforms the material into durable, functional and eco-friendly products before it reaches landfill.
BeeKeeper Parade T-shirts [For Pre-order] has arrived.
We are now chasing down our next target of unlocking our GIVE US WINGS Milestone, which is the $50,000 mark.

We thought we should begin our clothing range with an item that most of us wears on a daily basis. And it will be a good product to test and train our clothing team. Before we get onto more complicated things.
Here are some of the coolest things about our t-shirts:
For every t-shirt you buy, a student in our schools will get one too."" - Wow and amazing!
They help reduce fashion and textile waste.""
​""They support education in rural Cambodia through our support of the charity BabyTree Projects.""
They help create ethical jobs in our Imaginarium. Where all our products are made.""

column2:
>

 

Musvalk

Fierce, yet small and elegant. The smallest bird of prey in the order of falcons is called the Musvalk, in my native Dutch language. This creature perfectly embodies the knife I just created, which is why I chose its name to represent this knife and hopefully more knife designs in the future.

column1: As a designer I am always curious about exotic materials and how to use them effectively in my work. I happen to live in a very unusual neck of the woods where this fascination is nothing odd. Tucked away in a corner of the Mojave desert in California lies a little village where space travel is the talk of the town...every day of the week. It is where Richard Branson is developing his space program today.
It is where you can see test pilots and engineers have lunch at the local cafe, and it has a rich history of being at the cutting edge of space- and aircraft development.

It is here where I started to explore the possibility of creating a small knife, applying the very materials used in spacecrafts. I know, it sounds like a little boy's fantasy, but why not. By talking to whomever was not bound by confidentiality in this town, I got to see and feel these materials in person. From two engineers that worked on the space shuttle program, I learned about the amazing engineering and fatal mistakes which are an inevitable consequence of being at the cutting edge.

To make the translation from spacecraft to knife, I had to select materials that would have a place in my work. The properties that I was looking for were: light weight, hard edge and pleasing to the eye. Sometimes I had to chose a derivative material, to better suit my purpose.

Initial inspiration of the angular shape of the knife was the geometry of the Lockheed F117 Nighthawk stealth fighter jet, which was tested in this region too. Although its iconic design is purely functional, it is also a visual representation of stealth.

column2: >

column1: Once I settled on the materials I wanted to use, I had to educate myself on the limitations of the different manufacturing processes. What types of shapes can be made and which should be avoided. But I never lost sight of the ergonomics of the knife. Clay models and 3d printed prototypes helped me determine which shape allowed for an excellent grip and perfect position when pulled from the sheath when worn around the neck.

column2: >

column1: By selecting  zirconium dioxide ceramic (Zirconia) as the blade material, this knife has an edge hardness approaching that of diamond. You will never have to sharpen this knife. In addition, a 25% weight reduction was achieved, over using a traditional steel.

At the same time the Musvalk blade is thicker than any ceramic blade that I have come across. This extra girth is to negate the reduced impact resistance associated with this blade material. Please be assured that with normal use and handling, you should have a lifetime of cutting use from the knife.

column2: >

column1: As you can see, the blade comes in a few different colors. The blades are made by compressing the white Zirconia powder into a mold, applying enormous force, which consolidates the particles into the blade shape. It is then fired in a special kiln for days. When a blade is fired longer and under higher pressure, it turns from white to black and becomes slightly denser. However, I have been told that the difference in properties is negligible in the application as a knife.

The ""golden"" blade gets its color from an applied titanium nitride coating. This film is deposited as a vapor and is extremely wear resistant. It is often found on machine tools. Since the ceramic of the blade itself is already very wear resistant, the non coated blades are as sharp and wear resistant.

Carbon fiber is the material of choice for the hulls of spacecrafts of the past and present. The laminated fibers provide a superior stiffness and result in unbelievably light structures. I have applied a 2 mm twill weave carbon fiber to provide essential grip without adding unnecessary weight. As an additional option I am also considering a metal and fiberglass laminate, sometimes referred to as barracuda glass.

Even the sheath is largely made of carbon fiber, complimented with a material called Zytel. This glass reinforced nylon provides the spring power to hold the knife in place, and is very wear resistant. Custom made Torx head titanium bolts are used to securely fasten the separate parts of the design together.

column2: >

column1: Cost was the biggest challenge here as I learned that these tiny bolts can cost up to a dollar a piece! I electro-anodize the bolts to compliment the color of the blade. A deep blue for the black blade, and a gold color to match the color of the titanium nitride coated blade.
The knife comes with a Paracord neckless which has a tensile strength of 425 lbs, and is supplemented with a safety break away.

After many prototypes (as can be seen in the video), I am glad to say that all the knives that you see in the pictures here are pre-production models, meaning that they are as good as ready for production. I will be assembling the knifes with my own hands, but since the separate parts of this knife each require a highly specialized production process, they will be made elsewhere under my supervision. During the prototyping stage, I have developed a good working relationship with local and international manufacturers, who are excited to work with me (and all of you) to make this project happen.

column2: >

column1: Due to all the special molds and tooling that are required to produce this knife, the start-up costs of this project are higher than previous projects I have done. The height of the funding goal reflects this. (I haven't gotten greedy, if you were wondering) Each variation of the knife will also require an extra investment, which is why there are stretch goals. I laid it out below.

Those of you that have backed my projects in the past know that I very much consider the end result as a collective effort. I take any suggestions from you seriously and try to implement improvements right away, to include them in the final product. Underneath are a few quotes form backers of my previous campaigns. Let's make this happen...again.

This creature perfectly embodies the knife I just created, which is why I chose its name to represent this knife and hopefully more knife designs in the future.

As a designer I am always curious about exotic materials and how to use them effectively in my work. I happen to live in a very unusual neck of the woods where this fascination is nothing odd. Tucked away in a corner of the Mojave desert in California lies a little village where space travel is the talk of the town...every day of the week. It is where Richard Branson is developing his space program today.
It is where you can see test pilots and engineers have lunch at the local cafe, and it has a rich history of being at the cutting edge of space- and aircraft development.

It is here where I started to explore the possibility of creating a small knife, applying the very materials used in spacecrafts. I know, it sounds like a little boy's fantasy, but why not. By talking to whomever was not bound by confidentiality in this town, I got to see and feel these materials in person. From two engineers that worked on the space shuttle program, I learned about the amazing engineering and fatal mistakes which are an inevitable consequence of being at the cutting edge.

To make the translation from spacecraft to knife, I had to select materials that would have a place in my work. The properties that I was looking for were: light weight, hard edge and pleasing to the eye. Sometimes I had to chose a derivative material, to better suit my purpose.

Initial inspiration of the angular shape of the knife was the geometry of the Lockheed F117 Nighthawk stealth fighter jet, which was tested in this region too. Although its iconic design is purely functional, it is also a visual representation of stealth.
Inspiring geometry: the Lockheed F117 Nighthawk

Once I settled on the materials I wanted to use, I had to educate myself on the limitations of the different manufacturing processes. What types of shapes can be made and which should be avoided. But I never lost sight of the ergonomics of the knife. Clay models and 3d printed prototypes helped me determine which shape allowed for an excellent grip and perfect position when pulled from the sheath when worn around the neck.

By selecting  zirconium dioxide ceramic (Zirconia) as the blade material, this knife has an edge hardness approaching that of diamond. You will never have to sharpen this knife. In addition, a 25% weight reduction was achieved, over using a traditional steel.

At the same time the Musvalk blade is thicker than any ceramic blade that I have come across. This extra girth is to negate the reduced impact resistance associated with this blade material. Please be assured that with normal use and handling, you should have a lifetime of cutting use from the knife.

As you can see, the blade comes in a few different colors. The blades are made by compressing the white Zirconia powder into a mold, applying enormous force, which consolidates the particles into the blade shape. It is then fired in a special kiln for days. When a blade is fired longer and under higher pressure, it turns from white to black and becomes slightly denser. However, I have been told that the difference in properties is negligible in the application as a knife.

The ""golden"" blade gets its color from an applied titanium nitride coating. This film is deposited as a vapor and is extremely wear resistant. It is often found on machine tools. Since the ceramic of the blade itself is already very wear resistant, the non coated blades are as sharp and wear resistant.

Carbon fiber is the material of choice for the hulls of spacecrafts of the past and present. The laminated fibers provide a superior stiffness and result in unbelievably light structures. I have applied a 2 mm twill weave carbon fiber to provide essential grip without adding unnecessary weight. As an additional option I am also considering a metal and fiberglass laminate, sometimes referred to as barracuda glass.

Even the sheath is largely made of carbon fiber, complimented with a material called Zytel. This glass reinforced nylon provides the spring power to hold the knife in place, and is very wear resistant. Custom made Torx head titanium bolts are used to securely fasten the separate parts of the design together.

Cost was the biggest challenge here as I learned that these tiny bolts can cost up to a dollar a piece! I electro-anodize the bolts to compliment the color of the blade. A deep blue for the black blade, and a gold color to match the color of the titanium nitride coated blade.
The knife comes with a Paracord neckless which has a tensile strength of 425 lbs, and is supplemented with a safety break away.

After many prototypes (as can be seen in the video), I am glad to say that all the knives that you see in the pictures here are pre-production models, meaning that they are as good as ready for production. I will be assembling the knifes with my own hands, but since the separate parts of this knife each require a highly specialized production process, they will be made elsewhere under my supervision. During the prototyping stage, I have developed a good working relationship with local and international manufacturers, who are excited to work with me (and all of you) to make this project happen.

Due to all the special molds and tooling that are required to produce this knife, the start-up costs of this project are higher than previous projects I have done. The height of the funding goal reflects this. (I haven't gotten greedy, if you were wondering) Each variation of the knife will also require an extra investment, which is why there are stretch goals. I laid it out below.

Those of you that have backed my projects in the past know that I very much consider the end result as a collective effort. I take any suggestions from you seriously and try to implement improvements right away, to include them in the final product. Underneath are a few quotes form backers of my previous campaigns. Let's make this happen...again.

Looking great and feeling good has never been so easy! Get involved and create FashionABLE opportunities.

Did you know? In South Africa, the cost of higher education varies between 3000 and 5000 euro per year. Low wages (typically, parents may earn as little as 30 euro per month) and the lack of subsidized higher education combined with difficult access to finance and loans, exclude many young people from university education in a country that has a huge need for skilled labour (Socionext Program Overview 2012, pp.11)
We are a team of students studying at the University of Amsterdam (UvA), currently completing the Socionext: Social Entrepreneurship Challenge (http://socionext.org/)

Our team, ShirtStories, collaborates with artists to design our organic and ethically produced shirts (and tote bags). Each product and image connects to a short story that explains the Artist’s inspiration behind the design. All profits go directly to Socionext to provide scholarships for students in South Africa to be able to attend university.

“You have given me the opportunity, so I can fill up my studies, so I can realise my dream and have access to another life that I would love to have.” Mohau Molatudi (received a scholarship through StudieTrust in 2009. Socionext works with StudieTrust and TSiBA to administer the scholarships)
You can hear more of the inspirational student stories via http://socionext.org/scholarships/video-of-sa-students/

We are passionate about connecting art and fashion with a social purpose. Collectively we have skills in marketing, customer service, and photography, with previous experience in successfully implementing start-up projects. You can learn more about ShirtStories by visiting www.shirtstories.eu or sending us an email shirtstories2012@gmail.com

As we are a student start-up, we need the support of people who are passionate about art and creative industries, and understand the value of supporting young people to reach their full potential through learning and leadership opportunities. Does this sound like you?

1. Sponsorship/Financial Investment: $3,500 (US) (equivalent to €2800) will cover ShirtStories start up and production costs. ShirtStories projects an estimated €3800 profit, providing the cost of an educational scholarship for a year. Once our start up costs are secured and covered, then we are able to contribute any additional  profit, towards educational scholarships and increase access to education for motivated South African students.

2. Volunteer: ShirtStories needs 6 people to volunteer during the ShirtStories Launch Event (Amsterdam based) on Friday 7th December. We need people to help set up/pack down the event, check tickets at the door and generally help to ensure the event runs smoothly.
Your contribution will enable ShirtStories to launch new, creative, ethical and organic shirts and tote bags.  Besides looking good and feeling great, you can receive some extra ‘perks’:
1. A good, old fashioned - Thank you!
2. Complimentary tickets (for you and a friend) to the ShirtStories launch event (7th December, 2012) at Noorderlicht (Amsterdam), where you will get experience live music, dj and enjoy good company
3. Your choice of either a ShirtStories shirt or tote bag, from our first collection.

About Ose(Uh-Seh) and Why You Should Support This Campaign

Ose(Uh-Seh) “Vintage Wear With an Emphasis on Curve” was created by Ose Ogbemudia who gained experience working in the fashion industries for a variety of retailers which lead her to step out on her ow to create Ose(Uh-Seh). As a Plus-Size Women, Ose was frustrated with not finding unique and head-turning clothing for all occasions without spending a ridiculous amount of money. She started getting into vintage shopping with the economy getting tight and the going green movement becoming a priority and would see the response she would get from friends and family about the looks she created for herself and others. Ose wanted to provide her curvy divas with the same quality, affordable one-of-a-kind vintage that most curvy girls find it hard to find or put together.

Now that Ose(Uh-Seh) has been in business for a little over a year, we have been able to see the great response to vintage wear for our target market who are women size 12+ who love one-of-a-kind pieces and enjoy looks styled and reconstructed to make them stand out from the rest. We enjoy seeing the excitement and boost of confidence our clients receive when we provide them with looks they love and we're ready to do the same for our friends overseas starting in London with the first London Plus-Size Fashion Weekend.
Your support to help Ose(Uh-Seh) grow our business by going to London is not only going to provide our Curvy Divas in the UK with great clothing options, its so much bigger than that:

• Ose(Uh-Seh) can providing paid jobs to those who are seasoned models as well as allowing women who dream of breaking into Plus-Modeling world with opportunities to shoot with our company more frequently.

• Ose(Uh-Seh) can the Small Business Community on a larger scale by providing more jobs as we grow to photographers, make-up artist, and the many others small business we support as they do great work for us.

• Ose(Uh-Seh) can also give back to our community on a larger scale by starting programs to teach the youth and upcoming designs what the business of fashion is about, and the reality of being a small business owner.
If you believe in supporting any of these things, then supporting Ose(Uh-Seh) is something you should do.

We are looking to raise $15,000 to help cover the expensive of participating in London Plus Fashion Weekend and cover our expenses to travel and lodging for the trip. We also want to market our product to other Plus-Size Boutiques while we are out in London, so your donation will help us go forward with this initiative.
We have exciting some instant gratification for those who take the step to support Ose(Uh-Seh):
$5.00- Thank you email and shout out on our social media for your support.
$25- Thank you card, and name in drawing at end of campaign for $200 shopping spree on www.oseuhseh.com (men you can give as a nice holiday gift:).
$100 -Private video diary access of the entire London trip, personal thank you phone call and entry in $200 shopping spree on www.oseuhseh.com .
$200.00-Thank you breakfast in your honor for supporting! After our campaign in complete, we will hold a special thank you breakfast in the honor of those who supported in this capacity.

$600.00 Styling and Photo shoot For You! Makeup. styling and hair all done by the industries best as we make you shine in Ose(Uh-Seh)! If you are a male, we will provide you with a special vintage inspired shoot or you can gift the item to a friend.

$1000.00 I give back to you. Two hours with me and we can help you build your business by brainstorm together, or I can help you do something to get closer to your goal or business endeavor (Fineprint: BUSINESS related, all task must be appropriate and approved by me prior that it is within guidelines. Guidelines will be emailed to you after donation or can be requested prior).

$3000-A day of services from the OSE (Uh-Seh) Team for your business or future business endeavor (Fineprint: BUSINESS related, all task must be appropriate and approved by me prior that it is within guidelines. Guidelines will be emailed to you after your donation or can be requested prior).

If we do not raise the entire goal for this campaign, we are not giving up! We will use the money that is raised to start partnering with bloggers, magazines for advertising in the UK as well as reaching out to other boutiques to sell Ose(Uh-Seh) on consignment until we have built an audience in the UK market.

Your financial support to Ose(Uh-Seh) is helping to achieve our dreams as we reach back and help others achieve theirs. It is so much more than just a clothing line, it is a way to help build women confidence with quality, unique clothing. As Mary Kay Ashe who started the Mary Kay collection once said “While clothes may not make the woman, they certainly have a strong effect on her confidence which, I believe does make the women” and we at Ose(Uh-Seh) want to impact the woman all over the world with this principal. We want to help with the growth that he Plus-Size world is making today. Help us connect our US and UK fashionistas by getting Ose(Uh-Seh) in the first London Plus-Size Fashion Weekend. If you don’t have the means to make a financial contribution, please share our link with your network and help spread our campaign to the world!

Pura Vida Vintage - ""This is the Pure Life""

There are times when the universe calls you back to what is truly important.  Krystle Ramos experienced one of those times after being laid off from corporate America in 2012.  The decision forced her to reevaluate what was important in life.  Krystle is an artist but even after becoming an award-winning singer and songwriter, Krystle decided to put her young family first and forego her music career for financial stability.  In the 8 years that followed, Krystle learned how businesses ran, how products are developed and sold, what to do right and what to do wrong.  All of that culminated into jumping off the corporate treadmill and jumping out on her own.
Her love of vintage started very young
column2: from raiding her mother's closet to begging her dad for a '66 Mustang in high school, she knew old was new and vintage was cool.  Krystle opened Pura Vida Vintage in October 2012, starting online and putting the plan in motion for a brick and mortar store in 2013.  In late 2012, after searching and praying, Krystle found her storefront on Nashville's famous Music Row.  Vintage stores dotted East Nashville's hip hoods and 12South's cool vibe but who was helping the under served folks on the Row?  The college students at Belmont and Vandy?  Surely someone would step up and make it happen!

column1: Her mission is to bring the beautiful and forever trendy world of vintage fashion to all those who would appreciate it.  Help Krystle contribute to the vitality of Nashville's growing fashion community as well as helping others develop unique style and be fashionably green.  Oh, and help her accomplish her dream of freedom for her and her family.  Her brick and mortar store is set to open on March 1st, 2013 and so far, she has been fully self-funded, with as much help as possible from her incredibly supportive family members.  It's been difficult to say the least, but a path that she doesn't regret.
Investing in quality vintage pieces for the PVV archives (items to be sourced for local video and photo shoots in the music, fashion and entertainment industries.)
Building fully functional online shopping cart and purchase of lighting equipment for clothing shoots and look book production.
Taking local handmade cosmetics and accesories on consignment to promote local artisans and businesses.
Whatever donation amount is received will go towards these initiatives.

column2:
>Track Record

Krystle's success in the business world as an operations and then product manager gives her a unique advantage as an entrepreneur.  With 8 years of real world experience and not just a business degree, Krystle is a calculated risk taker.  At the same time, her desire for creativity and artistry keeps her head in the clouds and her dreams alive.

column1: Please spread the word via social networks and by visiting the shop in person and online.  Word of Mouth is a mutha!!
