For as long as I can remember I have always had a love for footwear design.  From the concept to a sketch on paper, to the handwork and stitching that make the shoe come alive, and on to the finished product in action on our busy city streets. The creation of a great shoe is more than footwear
column2: it's a work of art. As a footwear designer for the past 5 years, I've been able to design footwear for various brands, including Roberto Cavalli.  Learning the skill of handmade footwear in Firenze Italy has allowed me to fine-tune the craft of creating high quality, original footwear.  I have traveled back and forth from NY to Asia designing for multiple shoe factories. This has helped me to better understand the footwear i design, and allowed me to bring my dream to all of you!

column1: MICHAEL GREY FOOTWEAR is casual dress, where comfort is the key. I wanted to create a line that you could wear to the office, but is also perfect for an evening out. The men’s line is composed of gorgeous hand selected leathers, unique patterns, and hidden details all composed on a comfortable crepe outsole, while the ladies line has your day covered from conference room to cocktail dinner. Beautiful supple leathers, sleek silhouettes, and subtle details are its heart and soul. I feel this line is where old world handmade shoes, vintage craft, and fashion footwear design converge. With your support I hope to be able to share a piece of my dream with the world!
Here is what you will help to accomplish:
• Help cover the remaining cost of the first ever mass production order for 2013
• Allow MICHAEL GREY FOOTWEAR to participate in 2013 trade shows in NYC and Hong Kong!
• Help to pay for an add agency to promote the line
• Help cover cost for beginning the 2014 collection
• Make it possible to begin prototyping the bag and accessories line.
• Help with the cost of getting the online store up and running!

My name is Michael Mack, and I am a 27-year-old footwear designer. I graduated from the Savannah College of Art and Design in 2007 with a bachelor in Industrial design. After working in NYC as a shoe designer for two years, I found myself wanting to know more about the product I designed everyday. I developed a passion for the craft of hand made footwear. I soon found myself on a flight destined for Firenze Italy. There I attended POLIMODA to complete my yearlong masters degree in traditional handmade fashion footwear design. I gained knowledge in leathers, crafting, techniques, and European design concepts.  Finishing the year interning in Roberto Cavalli for 2 and a half months, I gained invaluable incite into the world of luxury footwear and products. Back in NY I began setting up my own private workshop in Brooklyn making handmade shoes, and designing what would become the MICHAEL GREY FOOTWEAR line.

MICHAEL GREY FOOTWEAR will not be just another fashion brand. I am striving to create meaningful fashion footwear for the design concious and globally concious. I have always wanted to find a way to use my skill set to give back to our world. In our society so many focus on taking, and so few think on how to give back. For this reason I am founding a program called ""Knowledge for Souls"". KFS will be an organization made up of volunteers that will go abroad to impoverished countries and communities to teach young people how to make sustainable footwear primarily with found or discarded materials that are readily accessible to them! One dollar of the profit from each pair of MICHAEL GREY FOOTWEAR will go to making KFS a reality! I am asking you to join me in my vision to start a movement that will impact the world.

Help spread the word!  Even if you are not able to provide financial backing, you can still help out in a major way. A brand is nothing without the people who support it, so please use the Indiegogo ""Share Tools"" to spread the word about MICHAEL GREY FOOTWEAR! Thank you for taking the time to visit this page, all contributions and publicity are greatly appreciated!

The purpose of this project is to gain cultural awareness of fashion design on RIT

Fashion Designers Association is a non-profit organization that aims to provide
resources and support to deaf fashion enthusiasts in different aspects of the Fashion
Industry, including designers, models, photographers, and filmmakers. We strive
to create a sense of community for those who are interested in making art
happen. DFDA plans on building programs to foster and support education,
start-ups, training, mentorship, and scholarship. Our mission is to enrich and
empower fashion enthusiasts for a better tomorrow.

column2: >I am Monika Kusinska, and I have been designing shoes for women for the

column1: HELPING women find their size of well-made and fitting shoes is a great cause to which I devote my passion and talents. PRESERVING Traditional Crafts is my second major priority for the M.O. of Autograf New York.

column2: >My journey started at age seven with

column1: a simple dream: ""I want to be a fashion designer!""
column2: >I graduated from Middlesex University in 1998, where I was first in my

column1: class, winning Bhs Graduate Fashion Week of 1998 -- Best Women's Collection.

column2: > My “Dream Come True Moment,” at twenty-six, was one I could not share with my father, Stefan Kusinski, who passed away six weeks before my graduation.

column1: This painful event sealed my devotion to my
profession. He taught me to never give up on my dreams!
Size Matters . . . was born out of my personal empathy for pains caused
by ill-fitting shoes. I wore shoes sized too small growing up and ended up
having surgery at twenty-three. Painful surgery, and long months of physical
therapy, left me scarred, mentally and physically, by literally, my passion for
I am size 12, and it has been challenging since my surgery to find
comfortable, well-made shoes. Acutely sensitive to uncomfortable shoes, I have
been trading my shoe sketches with APIA for shoes in my size. Fortunate to wear
Italian Handcrafted quality, I was forced to compromise at work -- designing
shoes on budget for large companies who cared mostly about profit margins while
When I was searching for inspiration to launch my own business, I ""discovered""
that my own life story, my genuine personal journey, is worthy of sharing with
people and is the catalyst for launching Autograf New York.
My feet took me to India in 2004, and I was fortunate to learn original
beading techniques and block-printing patterns. I have been designing women's shoes since 2004.
In 2009, I took over a Designer
post at Lucchese Boot Company and finally found a match for my passion for
Handcrafted Shoes and Boots. Lucchese, established in 1883, is still today

devoted to original wet lasting and traditional techniques of boot making.
For three years I contributed modern flair, contemporary designer experience to this awesome Boot House in El Paso, TX. I fell in love with the handcrafting aspect of this traditional craft - making shoes.
Your contribution to Size Matters . . . will allow us to purchase
EQUIPMENT to make larger sizes for women’s shoes. Currently, there are only a
handful of companies dedicated to supporting women with size 10 and up. We want
to be as trendy and fashionable as the regular sizes, wearing colors and
Your FUNDS will help us find factories willing to add size 11, 12, 13, 14,

column2: >Finally, your SUPPORT will ensure that the small, family-owned

column1: businesses in the world have a chance at surviving competition with mega-giants
Conserving Handcrafting Techniques is Equal to Preserving Historical Sites

column5: >After all, we need to pass down our legacy to the next generation. We need to protect the Anthropology of Fashion and Personal Style -- Autograf New York is devoted to helping, preserving and sharing unique skills of human hands.

column1: I am Monika Kusinska, and I have been designing shoes for women for the

HELPING women find their size of well-made and fitting shoes is a great cause to which I devote my passion and talents. PRESERVING Traditional Crafts is my second major priority for the M.O. of Autograf New York.
My journey started at age seven with
a simple dream: ""I want to be a fashion designer!"" I graduated from Middlesex University in 1998, where I was first in my
class, winning Bhs Graduate Fashion Week of 1998 -- Best Women's Collection.
My “Dream Come True Moment,” at twenty-six, was one I could not share with my father, Stefan Kusinski, who passed away six weeks before my graduation.
This painful event sealed my devotion to my
profession. He taught me to never give up on my dreams!
Size Matters . . . was born out of my personal empathy for pains caused
by ill-fitting shoes. I wore shoes sized too small growing up and ended up
having surgery at twenty-three. Painful surgery, and long months of physical
therapy, left me scarred, mentally and physically, by literally, my passion for
I am size 12, and it has been challenging since my surgery to find
comfortable, well-made shoes. Acutely sensitive to uncomfortable shoes, I have
been trading my shoe sketches with APIA for shoes in my size. Fortunate to wear
Italian Handcrafted quality, I was forced to compromise at work -- designing
shoes on budget for large companies who cared mostly about profit margins while
When I was searching for inspiration to launch my own business, I ""discovered""
that my own life story, my genuine personal journey, is worthy of sharing with
people and is the catalyst for launching Autograf New York.
My feet took me to India in 2004, and I was fortunate to learn original
beading techniques and block-printing patterns. I have been designing women's shoes since 2004.
In 2009, I took over a Designer
post at Lucchese Boot Company and finally found a match for my passion for
Handcrafted Shoes and Boots. Lucchese, established in 1883, is still today

devoted to original wet lasting and traditional techniques of boot making.For three years I contributed modern flair, contemporary designer experience to this awesome Boot House in El Paso, TX. I fell in love with the handcrafting aspect of this traditional craft - making shoes.
Your contribution to Size Matters . . . will allow us to purchase
EQUIPMENT to make larger sizes for women’s shoes. Currently, there are only a
handful of companies dedicated to supporting women with size 10 and up. We want
to be as trendy and fashionable as the regular sizes, wearing colors and
Your FUNDS will help us find factories willing to add size 11, 12, 13, 14,
Finally, your SUPPORT will ensure that the small, family-owned
businesses in the world have a chance at surviving competition with mega-giants
Conserving Handcrafting Techniques is Equal to Preserving Historical Sites

After all, we need to pass down our legacy to the next generation. We need to protect the Anthropology of Fashion and Personal Style -- Autograf New York is devoted to helping, preserving and sharing unique skills of human hands.

Autograf New York is a platform for sharing artwork and original techniques of artists and designers for other people. I want to educate consumers on how shoes are made by video-cataloging my journey, so they have a better understanding of the advantages of handcrafted products and can see the passion that goes into making them.
Our reward is to see the happy faces of families preserving that craft.

Our goals are to introduce new families, new factories and new designers while collaborating with other cities, hubs and organizations to preserve the art of handmade, without regard to profits, simply to live and consume artifacts touched with human intellect, thought and hands. APIA, my beloved Italian shoe factory, is the first to be introduced on Autograf New York.
This is my well-guarded secret -- Enjoy!

you looking for unique jewelry which you've never seen before?
Here
long time ago, Japanese warrior “Samurai” wears armor “Yoroi”
when they went to battle field. Yoroi

is known as beautiful art, nowadays.
We
all handmade and hand-painted which, inspired by Samurai armor. It
is based on traditional material and technology of the samurai era. It
is designed the detail 360 degrees, you can enjoy watching it when
you put it on or not.
It is made of sterling silver and coated by “Urushi”.
Urushi was treated as a sacred thing from ancient times.
Also silver as an assembly which similarly used for the talisman in the West.
Therefore, our products will become the “charm” which may protect you from evil.

column2: >Urushi is a kind of natural lacquer which is collected from the Urushi tree.

column1: It is a very rare natural materials which can take only a glass full from one tree.
It's worth twice as much as silver.
It is strong in heat or acid and will remains for thousand years.
Ultraviolet rays are the only weak points.
Samurai armor makers used urushi because of weatherproof and rust proof.
Our design refers to the traditional pattern and shapes of Japan.
Our artisan studied about traditional Urushi technique in Wajima, Ishikawa, Japan.
We make special Jewelry which nobody has seen.
column2: >Our product (Samurai ring) was succeeded in reaching goal at crowdfunding before.

>The Japanese Urushi industry is shrinking year by year. They will die out in the near future is all too real. We can't lose this beautiful art foam and we'd like to take a role to succeed in this traditional art in the future.

column1: There are so many cool shapes of Samurai helmet. We want to build a series of Samurai choker.
If this project will be successful, we're going to make upgrades and more variations of Samurai choker.

So If you feel something in this Samurai choker, please support this project.
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.

DEAR FAMILY, FRIENDS AND POTENTIAL SUPPORTERS, WELCOME TO SAMANTHA COLE LONDON'S INDIEGOGO PAGE!!!!!
If your here its because your either in my network of AB FAB friends, fans, supportive family or just browsing through considering who to support. Well, this is a really good place to start.....
Im a Fashion Designer with a passion for combining Art, Fashion &
column2: Technology into my collections. The label was officially set up in 2008 and since it's humble beginnings Ive been

column1:
- Awarded Best Womenswear Designer during New York Fashion Week for my 2009 Collection
- Nominated for Innovation in Design in 2009 at AAFW in Johannesburg, SA
- Nominated for International Emerging Female Designer 2010 at International Fashion Week in Johannesburg, SA
- BEFFTA Award nominee for Best Female Designer 2009 &
column2:
2010
- Officially Sponsored by London Fashion Week's On/Off to showcase as ""One to Watch""
- Mark Holgate of American Vogue is quoted as saying Im one of Britains Fashion Forward Designers.
- Featured in Italian Vogues ""TALENTS of 2010"".....

column1: The awards and acknowledgements have been great but as a creative what inspires and encourages my passion is the constant need to find new and innovative ways to combine my love of Art, Technology and Fashion.
Ive barely scratched the surface and constantly finding enjoyment in the journey of discovery and how best to apply this to my work.

Im constantly amazed at what technology provides in creating new innovative techniques, ideas, methodology in fibres that allow us to manipulate, enhance, construct, build and mould fabrics into shapes that allow people such as myself to be constantly inspired.
My style may be a little left field for some but this is who I am as a designer and these are the things that make me love what I do....

Im currently in the process of preparing my first full mini collection to be presented in February, its not as innovative as I would like it to be but Im pleased to be-able to introduce some new fabrics to the range.

Some of the materials are coming from an award winning European designer not known for fashion but his materials will give the collection some structure whilst maintaining its female empowering silhouettes.
It does seem like quite a mountain to climb in such a short time but I do believe with your generous support it will be possible.

Your contribution will help provide the fabrics, other materials and help produce the collection and if by some miracle we exceed the required amount, 40% (Forty Percent) of all additional funds will go towards a registered childrens charity. I will accept recommendations and narrow them down to the top 5 and the majority vote selected by you (contributors) will receive the funds. The rest will go towards marketing and promotional material.

To be completely honest I find it uncomfortably weird asking money from people I know, more so from people that I don't but when I stumbled upon Indiegogo and read what they were about I was pleasantly surprised.
Its not a charity or investment, its about giving people such as myself an opportunity to raise funds and offer supporters some great things in exchange for their contribution.
Every gift has a reward attached to it no matter how small the gift.

SOME REWARDS HAVE JUST BEEN CREATED EXCLUSIVELY FOR THIS CAMPAIGN like the never before seen sketches of my work along with a close-up of one of them being printed onto a canvas shopper bag and the warrior t-shirt which will also be hand-embellished after its been printed giving it that all important personal final touch.
Also the DVD copy of the show where all supporters get a mention in the credits will also be seen  when viewed on my website.....thought it would be a nice added touch :)
I do apologise for the lack of creativity for my male supporters but Im sure you have sisters, niece's, cousin's and partners that I hope will appreciate any one of the Design Packages.

I've given it much thought so check out the rewards bar to the right and you can see what's being offered along with updates from behind the scenes leading up to the show and my thoughts after the show.

As you know, word of mouth is the most effective marketing tool. Referral is the most effective gift that just keeps on giving so spread the word to all your friends, family and networks and link this page to your facebook, myspace, twitter accounts etc.
......and finally, I would like to take this opportunity to thank you all in advance for your  kind and generous support!!!

Im a Fashion Designer with a passion for combining Art, Fashion & Technology into my collections. The label was officially set up in 2008 and since it's humble beginnings Ive been

- Awarded Best Womenswear Designer during New York Fashion Week for my 2009 Collection- Nominated for Innovation in Design in 2009 at AAFW in Johannesburg, SA- Nominated for International Emerging Female Designer 2010 at International Fashion Week in Johannesburg, SA- BEFFTA Award nominee for Best Female Designer 2009 & 2010- Officially Sponsored by London Fashion Week's On/Off to showcase as ""One to Watch""- Mark Holgate of American Vogue is quoted as saying Im one of Britains Fashion Forward Designers.- Featured in Italian Vogues ""TALENTS of 2010"".....

The awards and acknowledgements have been great but as a creative what inspires and encourages my passion is the constant need to find new and innovative ways to combine my love of Art, Technology and Fashion.
Ive barely scratched the surface and constantly finding enjoyment in the journey of discovery and how best to apply this to my work.

Im constantly amazed at what technology provides in creating new innovative techniques, ideas, methodology in fibres that allow us to manipulate, enhance, construct, build and mould fabrics into shapes that allow people such as myself to be constantly inspired.
My style may be a little left field for some but this is who I am as a designer and these are the things that make me love what I do....

Im currently in the process of preparing my first full mini collection to be presented in February, its not as innovative as I would like it to be but Im pleased to be-able to introduce some new fabrics to the range.

Some of the materials are coming from an award winning European designer not known for fashion but his materials will give the collection some structure whilst maintaining its female empowering silhouettes.
I am currently looking to raise $4,000.
It does seem like quite a mountain to climb in such a short time but I do believe with your generous support it will be possible.

Your contribution will help provide the fabrics, other materials and help produce the collection and if by some miracle we exceed the required amount, 40% (Forty Percent) of all additional funds will go towards a registered childrens charity. I will accept recommendations and narrow them down to the top 5 and the majority vote selected by you (contributors) will receive the funds. The rest will go towards marketing and promotional material.
WHAT YOU GET OUT OF IT!!!!

To be completely honest I find it uncomfortably weird asking money from people I know, more so from people that I don't but when I stumbled upon Indiegogo and read what they were about I was pleasantly surprised.
Its not a charity or investment, its about giving people such as myself an opportunity to raise funds and offer supporters some great things in exchange for their contribution.
Every gift has a reward attached to it no matter how small the gift.

SOME REWARDS HAVE JUST BEEN CREATED EXCLUSIVELY FOR THIS CAMPAIGN like the never before seen sketches of my work along with a close-up of one of them being printed onto a canvas shopper bag and the warrior t-shirt which will also be hand-embellished after its been printed giving it that all important personal final touch.
Also the DVD copy of the show where all supporters get a mention in the credits will also be seen  when viewed on my website.....thought it would be a nice added touch :)
I do apologise for the lack of creativity for my male supporters but Im sure you have sisters, niece's, cousin's and partners that I hope will appreciate any one of the Design Packages.

I've given it much thought so check out the rewards bar to the right and you can see what's being offered along with updates from behind the scenes leading up to the show and my thoughts after the show.

As you know, word of mouth is the most effective marketing tool. Referral is the most effective gift that just keeps on giving so spread the word to all your friends, family and networks and link this page to your facebook, myspace, twitter accounts etc.
......and finally, I would like to take this opportunity to thank you all in advance for your  kind and generous support!!!

column7:
s=cf3e8f6a76ffb0c64baf1137ba862fbb"" src=""""/> Hand-made, tailor-made | Adventure-ready, air travel-helpful | Seriously-stylish, super-secure.

The Vanacci Traveller Wallet - minimalist style, seriously safe wallets made for travelling the world. Modern, contemporary, timeless - these wallets are all about the first impression.​

By tailor-made, we mean pick your shape, your size, (to match what you want to carry) choose your materials, colours, leather, linings (to match your style). Heck, you can even get your name engraved on it if you want. And when we say secure, we mean RFID secure (keeping you safe from even the most determined electronic pickpocket)
column14: >Once you've pledged, please choose your wallet from the catalogue links below and email it to oi@vanacci.com along with your backer number and engraving choice:

column20:
> 

Minimalism = Minus All that Unnecessary Stuff

Carry only what you need, save time checking in and have a more comfortable carry (including sitting back into your plane seat – free from that uncomfortable hard wallet case)
column26:
s=c3f284dd67ac0ba6fad71750f5bb478c"" src=""""/>

More than a passport holder, the Vanacci Traveller wallet is notebook-ready – making for a perfect travel companion whether stopping for coffee in NYC where you write your poems, or meandering through the Cévennes forest in France while writing your poems. With Vanacci, you can capture those moments and keep them safe.
column32:
s=7775b288e2c8d677a61d7011a7827e1b"" src=""""/>

Designed for every passport, the Vanacci Traveller is ready to go when you are – with the peace of mind that your passport and bank cards are wrapped in RFID blocking protection.

Those clouds up there… They’re fertile ground for ground-breaking ideas.  

And there’s literally no place on Earth that’s as helpful for your next big idea than a bed of clouds, because they're super comfy and nutritious. Featuring an understated stainless-steel barrel, the Vanacci Traveller wallet comes complete with a stainless steel pen that unobtrusively slides in and awaits that moment of inspiration. Blue-sky thinking all round, really.
column38:
s=58f01a615a9777e7418f2e40dce4c22d"" src=""""/>

Free Personalisation! We can engrave a message on the inside of your wallet or keep it classy with our Vanacci logo. 

Carry everything you need for your next adventure!
column44:
s=c3f284dd67ac0ba6fad71750f5bb478c"" src=""""/>

A minimal version is available in Traveller Classic, or perhaps you’d prefer increased functionality with the expanded Traveller Pioneer.

Our smallest wallet, yet still packs everything you’d need for your day.
column50:
s=4faf02f371a3659e0f786324ff77bc99"" src=""""/>

Designed to be small yet practical, you can fit plenty into Tasca and not worry about having left anything behind. Don't be fooled by it's size, good things come in small packages. 

Tasca benefits from the same RFID lining as Traveller and will keep your cards secure whilst you're on the go. Its size is another protective feature: it'll make such a small impact on your pocket, it'll be difficult to notice. UNTIL YOU BANG IT DOWN ON THE TABLE LIKE A BOSS!

Free Personalisation! We can engrave a message on the inside of your wallet or keep it simple with our Vanacci logo. We've had all sorts on our other designs, so go crazy. 

 Carry everything you need for your day to day adventures!
column56:
s=c7409ef5c67fcc2f8c188bf12cfbe6e0"" src=""""/>

For a minimal experience, choose Tasca Classic, or if you need to fit more in, choose Tasca Pioneer to carry even more. The Pioneer strap can be used to store extra cash and other items and the hook can be used for keys, attaching small items such as a USB stick or even attach yourself to a zip-line for a quick escape - don't do this (but if you do, film it. But don't do it).
column57: >Once you've pledged, please choose your wallet from the catalogue links below and email it to oi@vanacci.com along with your backer number and engraving choice:

column62: >Traveller Pioneer Catalogue
column64: >Once we have this we'll begin work on your new wallet immediately :)
column65:
> 

Now? We need you to join us on our next adventure. We’ve set our eyes firmly on the horizon – ready to sail into the distance with us? With you, the Vanacci Traveller wallet could take us from California dreaming, to UK-designed, developed and ready-for-the-world.

It’s all in the detail.  

This collection features sophisticated paisley linings in an array of colours to suit your style –these linings meet professional painted edges that cleverly use nano-paint technology (for a long-lasting, forever-luxury feel - each and every time you handle the wallet).

As for the leather, we use only the best - this leather adapts, flexes and fits to hold a remarkably large number of cards, change, business cards, a notebook, even keys. It’s called carbon leather. And it’s used for the toughest of jobs – such as the automotive industry. Over in our fashion world, it means superior resistance to abrasion. It means that the Vanacci Traveller wallet will stand the test of time, while holding firmly onto its style.

Here's a closer look at some of the leathers and fabric we use. More will be added as we meet goals in the campaign!

That planet down there…  

You could say we care. Style and being eco-minded aren’t mutually exclusive. That’s why our wallets use cork. It’s also why we’ve created a vegan-set for the animal-conscious.

Button Up

Completely bespoke. Not just one feature, or two. Not just the material. But every last detail. Like the customised buttons. Made from scratch to your exacting specification, this is the wallet you’ve been waiting for, for your tailor-made suit and shirts. This is the wallet the world is waiting for, with your help.

No corner is cut, no stitch is missed.  

We thought long and hard about every last detail of the Vanacci Traveller wallet – from the endless customisation options, to the threads that hold the minimalistic design together. High-tensile, superior-strength, this approach makes the Vanacci Traveller wallet as ready for skydiving and rock climbing as it is for long, lazy days by the pool.

Coming from the creators of molecular feats of smelling good (with the Lockstone), the Vanacci Traveller wallet follows in a line-up of crowd-backed products.  

We’ve patented perfume that meets jewellery, took on what it means to be a cufflink in this world and, by going au naturel with a line-up of sunglasses, we’ve redefined eye style for the sun (and helped the International Tree Foundation in the process).  

After all of that, GQ, Wired and Sky News have been talking about us! 

And if you think that’s impressive…

You Should Meet our Team…  

We've each spent more than 10,000 hours wishing you “Bon Voyage!”

We don’t mean to boast, but our team are AWESOME. Each and every one of them have honed their skills over the course of 10,000 hours or more – hours that they’ve spent designing, developing and handcrafting accessories to the highest of standards.  

Artisans? Yup. Craftsmen and women? Most definitely.

Risks and challenges

As this is our ninth Kickstarter, we're well prepared for the challenges of production, shipping and communication. New deals with FedEx and Royal Mail will allow us to pass on savings in shipping to our backers along with an improvement in delivery services.

 

","Hand-made, tailor-made | Adventure-ready, air travel-helpful | Seriously-stylish, super-secure.The Vanacci Traveller Wallet - minimalist style, seriously safe wallets made for travelling the world. Modern, contemporary, timeless - these wallets are all about the first impression.​By tailor-made, we mean pick your shape, your size, (to match what you want to carry) choose your materials, colours, leather, linings (to match your style). Heck, you can even get your name engraved on it if you want. And when we say secure, we mean RFID secure (keeping you safe from even the most determined electronic pickpocket)  Once you've pledged, please choose your wallet from the catalogue links below and email it to oi@vanacci.com along with your backer number and engraving choice: Tasca Classic CatalogueTasca Pioneer CatalogueTraveller Classic CatalogueTraveller Pioneer Catalogue Once we have this we'll begin work on your new wallet immediately :) Minimalism = Minus All that Unnecessary StuffCarry only what you need, save time checking in and have a more comfortable carry (including sitting back into your plane seat – free from that uncomfortable hard wallet case)More than a passport holder, the Vanacci Traveller wallet is notebook-ready – making for a perfect travel companion whether stopping for coffee in NYC where you write your poems, or meandering through the Cévennes forest in France while writing your poems. With Vanacci, you can capture those moments and keep them safe.Designed for every passport, the Vanacci Traveller is ready to go when you are – with the peace of mind that your passport and bank cards are wrapped in RFID blocking protection.Those clouds up there… They’re fertile ground for ground-breaking ideas.  And there’s literally no place on Earth that’s as helpful for your next big idea than a bed of clouds, because they're super comfy and nutritious. Featuring an understated stainless-steel barrel, the Vanacci Traveller wallet comes complete with a stainless steel pen that unobtrusively slides in and awaits that moment of inspiration. Blue-sky thinking all round, really.Free Personalisation! We can engrave a message on the inside of your wallet or keep it classy with our Vanacci logo. Carry everything you need for your next adventure!A minimal version is available in Traveller Classic, or perhaps you’d prefer increased functionality with the expanded Traveller Pioneer.Our smallest wallet, yet still packs everything you’d need for your day.Designed to be small yet practical, you can fit plenty into Tasca and not worry about having left anything behind. Don't be fooled by it's size, good things come in small packages. Tasca benefits from the same RFID lining as Traveller and will keep your cards secure whilst you're on the go. Its size is another protective feature: it'll make such a small impact on your pocket, it'll be difficult to notice. UNTIL YOU BANG IT DOWN ON THE TABLE LIKE A BOSS!Free Personalisation! We can engrave a message on the inside of your wallet or keep it simple with our Vanacci logo. We've had all sorts on our other designs, so go crazy.  Carry everything you need for your day to day adventures! For a minimal experience, choose Tasca Classic, or if you need to fit more in, choose Tasca Pioneer to carry even more. The Pioneer strap can be used to store extra cash and other items and the hook can be used for keys, attaching small items such as a USB stick or even attach yourself to a zip-line for a quick escape - don't do this (but if you do, film it. But don't do it).Once you've pledged, please choose your wallet from the catalogue links below and email it to oi@vanacci.com along with your backer number and engraving choice:  Tasca Classic CatalogueTasca Pioneer CatalogueTraveller Classic CatalogueTraveller Pioneer Catalogue  Once we have this we'll begin work on your new wallet immediately :) Now? We need you to join us on our next adventure. We’ve set our eyes firmly on the horizon – ready to sail into the distance with us? With you, the Vanacci Traveller wallet could take us from California dreaming, to UK-designed, developed and ready-for-the-world.It’s all in the detail.  This collection features sophisticated paisley linings in an array of colours to suit your style –these linings meet professional painted edges that cleverly use nano-paint technology (for a long-lasting, forever-luxury feel - each and every time you handle the wallet).As for the leather, we use only the best - this leather adapts, flexes and fits to hold a remarkably large number of cards, change, business cards, a notebook, even keys. It’s called carbon leather. And it’s used for the toughest of jobs – such as the automotive industry. Over in our fashion world, it means superior resistance to abrasion. It means that the Vanacci Traveller wallet will stand the test of time, while holding firmly onto its style.Here's a closer look at some of the leathers and fabric we use. More will be added as we meet goals in the campaign!That planet down there…  You could say we care. Style and being eco-minded aren’t mutually exclusive. That’s why our wallets use cork. column1: This design was originally drawn as an homage to my own backyard murder as they taught their new fledges how to mob a hawk, one fine morning in May 2017. It then proceeded to go viral, and almost immediately requests for shirts began to appear. Clearly, an idea whose time had come. Crows before bros. Support your local murder.

I am an artist and printmaker by profession, so I've been able to offer sew-on patches and fine art prints made by hand in small batches. The process I use is 100% analog, so my reproductions are as close to my original artwork as possible. But shirts? Beyond my reach. I don't have the time or the resources to turn into a t-shirt production company. Moreover, how could I—and why should I—hand over my crows to any old on-demand shirt company, in an industry that is up to its eyeballs in bros? Just because it was unexpectedly popular?
So You Like Crows, I Like Crows, Now What?

The demand for Crows Before Bros shirts has grown so, so much larger than I can meet with my own two hands. But I also want to offer you a shirt that I would feel proud to have my artwork on. I've been on the hunt for small, women-owned businesses who have ethical printing options and environmentally friendly methods.

What does that mean? It means you get a black unisex t-shirt made in safe, fair, legal and humane working conditions, and printed with environmentally friendly water-soluble ink by the fine folks at Threadbare. It's a super soft shirt, it's a deeply solid black, it's professional quality, and it's ready to be your favorite shirt. (Sizing chart is available in the FAQ.)

I've also listened to the requests for other forms that Crows Before Bros might take - pinback buttons, stickers, sew-on back patches larger than what I currently make myself. Put them all together and it looks an awful lot like a crowdfunding campaign. You get a shirt with my original artwork on it in your hands before anyone else, I get to offer these shirts in my shop in the long-term, together we get a chain reaction that starts benefitting small businesses! You can help me make all of this happen.

I’m bringing this campaign to you for a very simple reason. I am a one-person operation who makes art, and this is a project big enough to outsource to a professional crew of printers. Once all of the initial resources needed to make shirts (and all the other perks) are all collected, it will be so much easier to offer these as standard items in my Etsy shop, to fulfill purchases, and to order reprints. I've taken in feedback on the existing Crows Before Bros design, I've done the research, and I've crunched the numbers on those costs. But those initial resources are something I do not have to get started. Every pledge, no matter how big or small, gets this project closer to reality.

Together we can make this campaign a success, but sometimes these things fall short of the mark. What happens then? Indiegogo allows me to retain partial funding if the total goal is not met. All of those resources will be devoted to securing your pledged rewards, and any remaining funds after that will go towards a more modest investment in Crows Before Bros t-shirts offered as retail.

Extra perks, like pins and stickers, are additions I would have made sooner or later to my business. Their associated costs are achievable for me personally if funding doesn’t come through. The shirts themselves require a minimum order of 24. My cost estimates are based on a quantity of 50 so that there's room for flexibility.

Two dozen shirts seems achievable on the interest expressed, and turnaround on shirt production is quite nimble compared to publishing or other manufacturing processes. Working with outsourcing a design to a crew of professional printers is not something that I do often, but thanks to the festival and convention schedules I work with, as well as over 10 years of experience in fulfilling Etsy orders for my small business, setting and meeting production goals is no problem.
With familiarity of the processes and an estimated delivery date with plenty of elbow room,  I am confident that I can put your new favorite shirt into your hands.
Like any good crow person, you've probably got a knack for making noise about things that excite you. Maybe you want to tell your friends? Or tell your enemies. Tell complete strangers?
For more campaign updates and art adventures, you are welcome to follow me on Instagram: @chronographia

With familiarity of the processes and an estimated delivery date with plenty of elbow room,  I am confident that I can put your new favorite shirt into your hands.
Go Forth And Make Some Noise
Like any good crow person, you've probably got a knack for making noise about things that excite you. Maybe you want to tell your friends? Or tell your enemies. Tell complete strangers?
For more campaign updates and art adventures, you are welcome to follow me on Instagram: @chronographia

column15: related=indiegogo%3AIndiegogo"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">

column1:
We are Orbitkey

We believe that clever organisation leads to better living.

Over the past 4 years, we’ve brought two significant products to you here on Kickstarter, with the help of over 15,000 amazing supporters, from all over the world.

We love Kickstarter. Not only did you help bring Orbitkey to life, you also allow us to focus on making great products and keep doing the things we love – without the influence of outside investors. We love the community and communication that comes with creating a new product, and we are grateful for the many friends we have met along the way, many of which have joined our team.

This new project is the result of countless feedback and hard work for the past few years. We hope to have you join us on our journey towards better living.
column3:
>

We always try to be conscious of what we’re designing. To focus less on the quantity, and instead focus more on quality of the small but considered selection of products. Our hearts, minds and even weekends were poured into these new products, and we are excited to be sharing the process with you.

Adaptable design. Often, we are locked into things that you need to carry every day because it was very difficult to do otherwise. From the onset, we wanted to create something that truly flexible and versatile – both on the micro and macro level. Each component of the system is designed to work with each other and your belongings seamlessly. Our ring is designed to allow you to be more flexible with the things you need to carry. It allows you to quickly detach anything you do not need. This way, you can carry just the essentials at any given time.
column4:
>

Beautiful construction. Similar to our previous products, we blend traditional craft with the modern production process, to create something that’s uniquely elegant and functional. Together with our manufacturing partners, we aim to create consistent, high-quality goods that are going to serve you for a long time. In order for us to create a highly accurate leather goods, we had to design custom jigs to assist with aligning the components at the right place during construction. Each individual metal components have to go through many different processes to ensure the dimension accuracy and high-quality cosmetic finishes.
column5:
>

Material Science. Every component has been considered down to the very last details, including the material. Both the Ring and Clip have a unique construction. The design relies on two materials–so different in characteristic–working harmoniously to create a truly functional accessory. Finding a suitable material for this proves to be quite challenging. We needed to find a material that is flexible but has a really good shape-memory. This way, it will be easy to operate and will return to its original form straight after usage. After many failed attempts, we found that glass-filled polymer is the most suitable material for our application. Compared to the native polymer, it has improved mechanical properties of rigidity, strength and surface hardness – all while maintaining the flexibility.
column6:
>

Patent Pending Locking Mechanism. One of the most challenging things in the entire process is designing a locking mechanism that is secure but also easy to unlock when you need to. It took a while, but we created many different types of locking feature design and ended up with the one that works really well. Our locking feature design automatically drops into place when a full rotation has been made – ensuring that the inner ring will not rotate unintentionally. We also added a pull tab, so you can easily unlock the mechanism when you need to. In the process of creating an intuitive design, we ended up with an iconic look/silhouette for the product that we carried through to the design of the Clip.
column7:
>

Designed with you in mind. Similar to the original Orbitkey key organiser, the new products feature very clean aesthetic and minimal branding. The result is understated elegance that you can carry everywhere confidently. We’ve spent many hours, creating countless prototypes of different designs for each component. The size and usability are some of the most critical aspects we focus on perfecting. The final size was dictated by the ease-of-operation, size of keys, and also correct proportion. The surface is smooth to make it a pleasant accessory to interact with.

column2: >Perks: How, and when do I choose my preferred colour/style?
column3: >You will receive an email with the invite link to your Backerkit survey from support@s.backerkit.com AFTER 10 DAYS from the date of your order. In the survey, you'll be able to choose your preferred colour, add extra items, and update your details.
column4: >Perks: How do I order additional items?
column5:
>We've setup a few different bundle packs in the perks on the right of the campaign. However if you were looking to add something different OR create a different combination of items, simply choose a base perk and you can add extra items through your Backerkit survey that we will send you later.
Perks: What is an Original Orbitkey Key Organiser?
column6: >The Original Orbitkey Key organiser is another great way to carry your keys, which work perfectly in the system. We launched version 1 and version 2 Orbitkey Key Organiser on Kickstarter, and we’re making version 2 available as part of the Combo Packs for this campaign. Feel free to jump on to our website: www.orbitkey.com to check them out.
column8: >Products: I'm only after the Strap, or Clip without the Ring, is this option available?

column2: >We’ve designed each product to work functionally on its own, but even better together! The Ring comes part of the Strap, and the Clip system, so unfortunately the Clip or Strap won’t be made available just on its own. But what’s great about the products is you will have the option to use all / or one part of it, and customise as you like!
>Products: Can I use the Orbitkey Clip for climbing?
column3: >Not that we’ve tried, and we don’t recommend for you to either! Our Clip is not designed to use for rock climbing, or as a safety harness equipment. The Orbitkey Clip is suitable and great to use for your everyday carry such as your keys, tags, drink bottle.
column4: >Products: Can I use any key or accessory (like car key fob) on my Orbitkey Ring? Will they fit?
column5: >Sure can! As long as the hole on the key or car fob is greater than 3.6mm wide, it will fit through the Ring.
column6: >Products: What are the dimensions of the Orbitkey Clip, Ring and Strap?
column7:
>Orbitkey Clip only - Length: 52mm, Width: 30.5mm, Thickness: 4.5mm 
Orbitkey Clip system - Length: 103mm, Width: 30.5mm, Thickness: 4.5mm 
Orbitkey Strap system - Length (tip to tip with the ring): 238mm, Length (Strap only): 207.5mm, Width of the leather: 14mm, Thickness of the leather: 1.6mm 
Orbitkey Ring - Diameter: 30mm, Thickness: 3.5mm, *Opening: 3.6mm
column8: >Products: Can I use the Orbitkey Ring, Clip and Strap with the Orbitkey Key Organiser.
column9: >Most definitely, in fact, we encourage it! All our products work great on their own but together they create an ecosystem to help manage and organise your everyday essentials. Use the Orbitkey Ring to carry and quickly detach your car keys and other bulkier items, Use the Orbitkey Clip to hook your Orbitkey on your belt loop or bag and use the Orbitkey Strap to wrap your orbitkey around your wrist or tie it to your bag.
column10: >Shipping: When will I receive my stuff?
column11: >We aim to have manufacturing completed in March 2018, and send stock to our fulfilment centres (Melbourne, LA, Hong Kong, Netherlands, and UK). We hope to start shipping rewards by April 2018. We will keep all of our backers updated and be completely transparent with progress.
column13: >Shipping: What shipping method will you be using?
column14:
>Australia: All Australian orders will be shipped directly from our office in Melbourne via Australia Post. 
United States: All orders will be sent from our fulfilment centre located in LA, orders will be shipped via USPS with tracking. 
Europe: All orders will be sent from our fulfilment centre located in UK, and from the Netherlands. Orders will be shipped via the following methods: Royal Mail, DHL Global Mail, or GLS Ground Service. 
International: Orders outside US, Europe and Australia will be sent from our Hong Kong fulfilment centre. All orders will be shipped with tracking.
column15: >Shipping: How much is shipping?
column16: >Shipping is a standard flat fee of $6 for Australia and the United States, and $8 for the rest of the world.
column18:
>Have another question? Please message us directly through Indiegogo, we’d be more than happy to answer any questions.

As long as the hole on the key or car fob is greater than 3.6mm wide, it will fit through the Ring.Products: What are the dimensions of the Orbitkey Clip, Ring and Strap?Orbitkey Clip only - Length: 52mm, Width: 30.5mm, Thickness: 4.5mm Orbitkey Clip system - Length: 103mm, Width: 30.5mm, Thickness: 4.5mm Orbitkey Strap system - Length (tip to tip with the ring): 238mm, Length (Strap only): 207.5mm, Width of the leather: 14mm, Thickness of the leather: 1.6mm Orbitkey Ring - Diameter: 30mm, Thickness: 3.5mm, *Opening: 3.6mmProducts: Can I use the Orbitkey Ring, Clip and Strap with the Orbitkey Key Organiser.Most definitely, in fact, we encourage it! All our products work great on their own but together they create an ecosystem to help manage and organise your everyday essentials. Use the Orbitkey Ring to carry and quickly detach your car keys and other bulkier items, Use the Orbitkey Clip to hook your Orbitkey on your belt loop or bag and use the Orbitkey Strap to wrap your orbitkey around your wrist or tie it to your bag.Shipping: When will I receive my stuff?We aim to have manufacturing completed in March 2018, and send stock to our fulfilment centres (Melbourne, LA, Hong Kong, Netherlands, and UK). We hope to start shipping rewards by April 2018. We will keep all of our backers updated and be completely transparent with progress. Shipping: What shipping method will you be using?Australia: All Australian orders will be shipped directly from our office in Melbourne via Australia Post. United States: All orders will be sent from our fulfilment centre located in LA, orders will be shipped via USPS with tracking. Europe: All orders will be sent from our fulfilment centre located in UK, and from the Netherlands. Orders will be shipped via the following methods: Royal Mail, DHL Global Mail, or GLS Ground Service. International: Orders outside US, Europe and Australia will be sent from our Hong Kong fulfilment centre. All orders will be shipped with tracking.Shipping: How much is shipping?Shipping is a standard flat fee of $6 for Australia and the United States, and $8 for the rest of the world. I have another question?Have another question? Please message us directly through Indiegogo, we’d be more than happy to answer any questions.",37.0,0,"5 Campaigns

0,"

 

Hi. We’re Fang &
column2:
Hoof, a friendly little company from the Pacific Northwest that makes men’s accessories. This campaign is to see if there's any interest out there in doing a larger production of our nifty Hatchet wallet, or as we like to call it  ""The Card Sheath."" We made a limited run of 100 brown wallets and 50 black. We have them made and all ready to ship so you can get yours before Christmas. Warning—this will be a quick campaign— so if you like what you see don't hesitate otherwise, you might never know the sweet joys of owning a card sheath. Without further adieu... behold HATCHET!

Hatchet = Simple Design + Quality Craftmanship

The genius behind Hatchet is its simple threadless design. Hatchet is made from a single piece of quality leather and three snaps, which means all the focus is on perfecting the few things that make Hatchet so freakin’ fantastic. 

Uniquely Yours

Hatchet can be described as cognac or light to medium brown. Because no two pieces of leather are exactly alike, the unique color of Hatchet will vary. As your legend unfolds, Hatchet will become distressed and worn, giving it an even more custom appearance.

One of our prototype testers has this message for you.  Take it away Matt...

column1:
Sizecurity
 

Size + Security = Sizecurity. When it comes to your EDC (Every Day Carry) needs size and security are top of the list. That's why Hatchet's size is optimized for utility. Measuring in at 12in X 2in X 2cm (without cards) it holds up to 15 cards organized into two convenient slots that snap close, giving you peace of mind that can't be beat. “Poppin' Snap” the tactile treat that happens when you pop a snap to get your cards out.

Hatchet Habitat

Hatchet rides in the front pocket of your trousers or jacket. While it certainly can live in your back pocket, the snaps can be kind of a pain in the pants, so we don't recommend it, but we won't stop you. You. Be. You. 

The Legend Unfolds

Hatchet will arrive already snapped and ready to fill with your cards
column2:
however, in order to appreciate Hatchet's simple design, we recommend unfolding it at least once or make a few bucks on the side  performing at your local Renaissance fair by turning an unassuming piece of leather into Hatchet with just a few quick folds.

Pro Tip: Remember no tips, no pictures. Use your Hatchet wallet to make a few bucks on the side by performing at your local Renaissance fair.

 

Bring the Legend Home

Hatchet is a rugged trusty companion, built to be the last wallet you’ll ever want or need. And thanks to a dedicated team of craftsmen and your help, the legend can become yours.

anti-odour | Cinnamon is naturally anti-microbial, which inhibits the growth of odour producing bacteria.

column1: 100% Natural | Cinnamon is used to replace harmful chemicals / heavy metal coatings, which can be washed off in as little as 5 washes!
Long-lasting performance | Patented technology infuses cinnamon extract into the yarns so it does not wash off.

Tons and tons of clothing are thrown away by consumers each year, and most of them ended up in landfills, incremented, or even worse, become ocean waste. Much of the discarded clothing are very difficult to recycle because they are made from mixed materials like polyester and cotton mix. But not with the Koup cinnamon t-shirt! Our t-shirt is made not only with recycled material in mind but more importantly, to be recycled at the end of its life.

To fully realise our vision of the circular clothing economy, we need to close the loop in the apparel industry. We encourage you to send our t-shirt back to us when you are done with it, where we can recycle them to make new yarns for new garments. Or alternatively, you can simply take them to the local recycling facilities that accept textile waste!

We smell after sweating because bacteria break down proteins in our sweat into acids, which contains odour. One way to eliminate the smell after sweating is to reduce or inhibit the growth of odour producing bacteria on your skin. We have tested our fabric containing cinnamon extracts against Staphylococcus aureus - one of the most common odour-producing bacteria on our skin.

The picture on the left is when the bacteria are first introduced to the petri dish, as you can see the white dots are the actual bacteria! After 18-24 hours in contact with the cinnamon fabric, almost all the bacteria disappeared on the surface of our fabric. And since the odour-producing bacteria can't grow on the cinnamon t-shirt, we eliminate the annoying smell after sweating, keeping you fresh on the go.

What's even better is that we use a patented technology that combines cinnamon extracts with recycled polyester that are then made into yarns, fabrics and garments. In contrast to chemical or heavy metal coatings that are temporary and are washed off in as little as 5 washes, our anti-odour function will last the lifetime of the t-shirt!
We tested the anti-microbial property of the t-shirt after 20 washes, and the result shows the function did not fade a bit.

Moisture-wicking is usually achieved by adding chemical coatings to the fabric, whereas the Koup cinnamon t-shirt uses physics to do the work. We use a more expensive customised yarn which has a special cross-section to promote capillary action. As a result, it draws water away from the skin quicker and leaving you dry and comfortable after work-outs.

The Koup cinnamon t-shirt has a textured jacquard structure (almost like many pores in the fabric), allowing air and sweat to exchange freely through the fabric. This allows body heat to pass through the fabric to the ambient environment, so you feel comfortable when wearing the t-shirt.

Our novel Agile-fit™ that compliments any body type and our newly improved fabric have more stretch than the previous version. With the new knitting method, we have increased the stretchiness of our fabric by 30%.
The Koup cinnamon t-shirt is made free of toxic chemicals (REACH &
column2: OEKO-TEX compliance) and from recycled material (Global Recycled Standard approved yarn supplier). We use Bluesign certified dye mill to dye our fabrics and our garment manufacturer is Worldwide responsible accredited production (WRAP) certified. We only source our raw material from suppliers who have gone through the industry's most stringent tests on sustainability to ensure our product is truly environmentally friendly.

column1: Environmental accreditations for the Koup Cinnamon T-shirt

To go the extra mile, we make our packaging out of otherwise wasted fabric trims and use bio-degradable postage bags, so that we minimise the footprint on the earth. To close the loop, our t-shirt is made with single material so it's fully recyclable.
The t-shirt is designed based on European sizes with a regular fit. If you are in-between sizes, either go down a size if you prefer a more muscular fit or go up a size for a more relaxed fit.
If you are unsure about your size, please email us at koup.club@gmail.comand we would love to help!
Alternatively, you can refer to the table below to find out the pledge amount for your preferred combo:

Special shout out to our partners who helped us to make this campaign a reality! Thank you Mike, Ian, Lee and Adam for the amazing videos and photos, Matt and Ffion for agreeing to model for us and Jade for arranging the shoot for us.

The materials we use are 100% customised for us. We will be working with a renowned Taiwanese yarn supplier, using their patented cinnamon yarn technology to create our permanent anti-odour yarn. We have however stepped up a gear to combine this technology with recycled polyester and special texturing of the yarn for our wicking function. This is truly a revolutionary material that no one has attempted before and there may be delays or unforeseen circumstances in the production of the yarn. For fabric and garment production, we will be working with trusted manufacturers, who supply many global brands. Regardless, there could be production delays as with any manufacturing.
We will perform thorough checks of the finished pieces using industrial QC standards. However, all measurements will include an allowed 0.5 - 1.5cm depending on the measurement.

We will be working with a local fulfilment centre in Taiwan, hence custom charges may apply. Each parcel will have a tracking number so it can be tracked. Unfortunate events may happen in that the parcel will get lost during its delivery but we will do everything we can to help track them down, however, we are not responsible for packages delivered outside the expected time frame.
• May not be suitable for people with cinnamon allergy.
• Do not use silicone-based detergent when washing and do not use fabric softener.
• We suggest hand wash your Koup shirt at low temperature and no tumble dry.
• Actual colour may look different from the screen.
• Our anti-odour function inhibits the growth of odour-producing bacteria but does not prevent other odours from being transferred onto the shirt.

Hello fellow adventurers! We are Stephen &
column2:
Tiffani from The Intrepid Bag Co. You may remember us from last year. After a successful and exciting campaign we brought you the Journeyman Leather Messenger Bag and the Lillium Leather Side Purse, and we delivered to rave reviews (we've included a few on this page).

This

column1: year we have partnered with Brian Holmes from Pad &amp
are excited to bring you our all new Explorer line of leather goods for
modern day intrepid wanderers. This line up includes some incredible
innovations such as the instantly convertible Zinnia backpack/crossbody
bag, the spacious Wayfarer Messenger, a Slim Wallet, rugged Camera
Strap, and the extremely useful and unique Tech Roll cord organizer.
Take a look!
The Wayfarer Messenger bag is brimming with space, versatility, and durability. It's the bag Indiana Jones would be jealous of.
Perfect for any situation- from a day in the urban jungle to a week
exploring ancient ruins. It features an incredible body contouring
design that can be worn comfortably across the back or along the side on
either shoulder. Crafted from thick saddle leather with hand stitched
seams and hand pounded rivets. The Wayfarer well characterizes our obsession of uncompromising quality with an almost absurd attention to detail.
This bag has space! Inside you can easily fit a 17” laptop, iPad, a
change of clothes, and all your other tech with room to spare. The side
pockets fit up to an iPhone 6 along with a journal and some pens for
quick access.  The front expanding pockets are perfect for an iPad Mini,
a Macbook charger, and even our brilliantly useful Tech Roll.
Every detail has been carefully considered, from the marine grade
UV-resistant stitching, the hand-pounded copper rivets on the lay-flat
handle, the contoured angles on every side, the classic herringbone
lined interior, to the USA sourced full grain super thick and durable
• Exterior side pockets for an iPhone 6 Plus, with flap closure
• Angled shoulder straps for ergonomic comfort
• Lay flat rear handle with copper rivets
• 100% Made in USA vegetable tanned full grain coffee saddle leather
• UV-Resistant Marine-grade nylon stitching (used in parachute construction)
We are also throwing in a special
bonus gift of two 20"" leather lash straps with every Wayfarer Messenger.
These straps can be used to mount additional gear to the outside of the
bag (tripod, blanket, jacket, yoga mat, etc...) for even more
versatility using the handy mounting points on the bottom of the bag.
The Zinnia Convertible is an instantly convertible backpack/crossbody
bag coming in a luxurious Mahogany leather and fitting up a 13"" laptop
as well as a ton more. The unique conversion system we designed just may be the best thing ever.
It means no fumbling, no stress, just grab and pull. The classic
styling and high quality construction means this bag will always look
good, in fact it just gets better with age. Great for everything from
your morning commute to a weekend away. The Zinnia is the perfect companion for any on-the-go intrepid soul.
Another unique feature is the wider-at-the-bottom design. This means
it is stable enough to stand up on its own while still fitting a
surprising amount of your daily essentials. The rich Mahogany leather is
really showcased in the cascading front flap with interior rain flaps
to keep the interior dry and safe.
The padded laptop pocket is big enough for up to a 13” laptop. The
main bucket can hold almost anything, including an SLR camera! The
expanding side water bottle pockets hide away when not in use, while
adding a splash of style. There are also two quick access pockets on the
back for your phone and papers, and another front pocket with a
magnetic closure for all your loose items. Everything in the Zinnia
stays easily accessible as well as organized.
Zinnia crafted with beautiful, supple, and durable mahogany leather, it
is also lined with a rich taupe wool fabric-blend imported from England
and accented with forged steel hardware.
• Instant Grab-and-Pull Conversion From Backpack to Crossbody Bag
Cascading Front Flap with Secure Tuck-Clasp
Top Handle with Elegant Petal Shape for Hand Carry
• 100% Made in USA Vegetable Tanned Full Grain Mahogany Saddle Leather
• UV Resistant Marine-Grade Nylon Stitching (used in parachute construction)
We are also throwing in a special
bonus gift of two 20"" leather lash straps with every Zinnia Convertible.
These straps can be used to mount additional gear to the outside of the
bag (tripod, blanket, jacket, yoga mat, etc...) for even more
versatility using the handy mounting points on the bottom of the bag.
The Intrepid Tech Roll is a completely unique tuck-and-roll
organizational system for all your small tech items such as: cords, hard
drives, battery back-up, plugs, power bricks, and more. Some have
called it ""pure genius,"" a ""must-have,"" and ""the coolest thing we've
seen in a long time."" We just call it ""Awesome.""
The brilliance in this design is that you do not have remove any of
the items from the Slate Grey canvas pockets to use them. Each has a
pull-through plug opening that lets you both plug in and charge without
removing anything from the Tech Roll, so everything always stays
organized and tangle free. In addition to the cord pockets, there is a
large covered pocket for storing a battery pack or hard drive. Just pull
the plug through and you are ready to use it.
A zippered pocket is also there to put all your loose odds and ends
in a safe place, it is even big enough to fit the entire power brick and
charging cord for most laptops with room to spare! There is also two
exterior specially sized mini pockets for SD Cards.  This all folds up
elegantly and compactly into a Mahogany leather exterior that speaks for
itself, with wrap-around straps for full secure expansion. This is
especially great for travel because it is as simple as opening the Tech
Roll and plugging in. No stray cords to lose, no fumbling around to find
your small tech. When you are finished, just tuck and roll.
• Tuck-and-roll design means all chords, hard drives, and battery back ups are fully useable without removing them.
• 3 cord pockets with fully accessible plug openings
• Large covered pocket for hard drive or a battery backup, fully accessible
• Zippered pouch for loose gear, with exterior SD card mini-pockets
<li>    100% Made in USA vegetable tanned full grain mahogany saddle leather
Two Leather Wrap Around Straps for Secure Full Expansion
Meet the world's most durable, luxuriant, and comfortable leather
camera strap. An ultra-soft and ergonomically designed shoulder pad that
cradles your neck in a subtle moon shape, while 2 forged steel d-rings
allow the strap to move freely without putting stress on the shoulders.
Secure locking hardware attaches to the tripod mount at the bottom of
the camera allowing it to hang on your side so it is always in reach
but never in the way. This allows the camera to slide freely along the
strap for quick and easy usage.
• 100% Made in USA vegetable tanned full grain Coffee saddle leather
The Intrepid Slim Wallet is a wallet for the minimalist with 4 boldly
angled pockets that are perfect for storing the basics you need without
all that extra bulk. It is constructed using rugged saddle stitching
made from UV-resistant marine grade nylon that is also used in parachute
construction, meaning this wallet will last. The wallet has a special RFID blocking material built in to keep your personal data personal. The full grain coffee
saddle leather will age with you and only look better with day to day
We are a designer couple living in the Bay Area of San Francisco. As
avid world travelers, language learners, volunteers, and artists we are
always on the hunt for the perfect bags to take with us on our
adventures, the kind of bags that will go anywhere, from the streets of
Berkeley to the ruins of Ephesus, from the New York Rat Race to the
Scotland Highlands, from our favorite neighborhood tea cafe to the
Last year we ran a kickstarter to launch our first two bags: the
Journeyman Commuter and the Lillium Side-purse. The response was
fantastic and the rave reviews speak for themselves. Here's just a few:
ask you: is there a better feeling than when someone says, ""awesome
bag! Looks like something Indiana Jones would use."" Of course there
• ""I got this bag for my significant other and he loves it. Beautiful leather and craftsmanship- he uses it every day."" -Caitlyn F.
think these bags find the perfect balance between professional and
casual. I take mine to work everyday. It fits my 15 inch laptop
perfectly, and fits snugly enough that it doesn't get in the way during
my train commute. Worth every penny."" -Chris B.
got this bag for my trip over the pond, but since I've been back home, I
haven't wanted to give it up, so I'm using it every day. And, I just
bought a 2nd one, to be sure that I have a backup in case something
happens to mine and I can't replace it!"" -Linda C.
""Finest leather, perfect work, great design. The Lillium won’t be the last Intrepid stuff I buy, for sure!"" -Roland M.
we haven’t stopped there! After many hours of design and many many
prototypes, our new line of products takes everything we learned from
our first two bags and rolls them into a brand new lineup.
Each and every item is made by hand, the old-fashioned way, by
craftsman who have been doing this for generations. Constructed from the
highest quality materials in the world, and designed without
compromise. The end results are conscientiously made, artfully crafted,
heirloom quality products for modern day explorers and adventurers.
July: Finalize prototypes, create gold samples, order dies
August: Order materials and begin production on products
September: Continue production and quality control inspections
As crowdfunding veterans with 2 years of business under our belt, we
have many of the risks and challenges very well mitigated. We have also
partnered again with Brian Holmes of Pad &amp
extensive product development, manufacturing, and delivering experience
into play to help ensure everything runs smoothly.
Of course, when having products made by hand there is always the risk
that things might take a little longer than expected. Slight delays may
happen since multiple suppliers are involved in sourcing materials and
getting things set up. That is the biggest risk we face.
We are committed to keeping our products to the highest standards and
have multiple levels of quality assurance checks to make sure that each
and every bag is the highest of quality before we ship. We will not
ship a single inferior product, that is our promise to you.

The Zinnia Convertible is an instantly convertible backpack/crossbody
bag coming in a luxurious Mahogany leather and fitting up a 13"" laptop
as well as a ton more. The unique conversion system we designed just may be the best thing ever.
It means no fumbling, no stress, just grab and pull. The classic
styling and high quality construction means this bag will always look
good, in fact it just gets better with age. Great for everything from
your morning commute to a weekend away. The Zinnia is the perfect companion for any on-the-go intrepid soul.
Another unique feature is the wider-at-the-bottom design. This means
it is stable enough to stand up on its own while still fitting a
surprising amount of your daily essentials. The rich Mahogany leather is
really showcased in the cascading front flap with interior rain flaps
to keep the interior dry and safe.
The padded laptop pocket is big enough for up to a 13” laptop. The
main bucket can hold almost anything, including an SLR camera! The
expanding side water bottle pockets hide away when not in use, while
adding a splash of style. There are also two quick access pockets on the
back for your phone and papers, and another front pocket with a
magnetic closure for all your loose items. Everything in the Zinnia
stays easily accessible as well as organized.
Zinnia crafted with beautiful, supple, and durable mahogany leather, it
is also lined with a rich taupe wool fabric-blend imported from England
and accented with forged steel hardware.
Instant Grab-and-Pull Conversion From Backpack to Crossbody Bag
Cascading Front Flap with Secure Tuck-Clasp
Top Handle with Elegant Petal Shape for Hand Carry
100% Made in USA Vegetable Tanned Full Grain Mahogany Saddle Leather
UV Resistant Marine-Grade Nylon Stitching (used in parachute construction)
We are also throwing in a special
bonus gift of two 20"" leather lash straps with every Zinnia Convertible.
These straps can be used to mount additional gear to the outside of the
bag (tripod, blanket, jacket, yoga mat, etc...) for even more
versatility using the handy mounting points on the bottom of the bag.
The Intrepid Tech Roll is a completely unique tuck-and-roll
organizational system for all your small tech items such as: cords, hard
drives, battery back-up, plugs, power bricks, and more. Some have
called it ""pure genius,"" a ""must-have,"" and ""the coolest thing we've
seen in a long time."" We just call it ""Awesome.""
The brilliance in this design is that you do not have remove any of
the items from the Slate Grey canvas pockets to use them. Each has a
pull-through plug opening that lets you both plug in and charge without
removing anything from the Tech Roll, so everything always stays
organized and tangle free. In addition to the cord pockets, there is a
large covered pocket for storing a battery pack or hard drive. Just pull
the plug through and you are ready to use it.
A zippered pocket is also there to put all your loose odds and ends
in a safe place, it is even big enough to fit the entire power brick and
charging cord for most laptops with room to spare! There is also two
exterior specially sized mini pockets for SD Cards.  This all folds up
elegantly and compactly into a Mahogany leather exterior that speaks for
itself, with wrap-around straps for full secure expansion. This is
especially great for travel because it is as simple as opening the Tech
Roll and plugging in. No stray cords to lose, no fumbling around to find
your small tech. When you are finished, just tuck and roll.
Tuck-and-roll design means all chords, hard drives, and battery back ups are fully useable without removing them.
3 cord pockets with fully accessible plug openings
Large covered pocket for hard drive or a battery backup, fully accessible
Zippered pouch for loose gear, with exterior SD card mini-pockets
100% Made in USA vegetable tanned full grain mahogany saddle leather
Two Leather Wrap Around Straps for Secure Full Expansion
Meet the world's most durable, luxuriant, and comfortable leather
camera strap. An ultra-soft and ergonomically designed shoulder pad that
cradles your neck in a subtle moon shape, while 2 forged steel d-rings
allow the strap to move freely without putting stress on the shoulders.
Secure locking hardware attaches to the tripod mount at the bottom of
the camera allowing it to hang on your side so it is always in reach
but never in the way. This allows the camera to slide freely along the
strap for quick and easy usage.
100% Made in USA vegetable tanned full grain Coffee saddle leather
The Intrepid Slim Wallet is a wallet for the minimalist with 4 boldly
angled pockets that are perfect for storing the basics you need without
all that extra bulk. It is constructed using rugged saddle stitching
made from UV-resistant marine grade nylon that is also used in parachute
construction, meaning this wallet will last. The wallet has a special RFID blocking material built in to keep your personal data personal. The full grain coffee
saddle leather will age with you and only look better with day to day
We are a designer couple living in the Bay Area of San Francisco. As
avid world travelers, language learners, volunteers, and artists we are
always on the hunt for the perfect bags to take with us on our
adventures, the kind of bags that will go anywhere, from the streets of
Berkeley to the ruins of Ephesus, from the New York Rat Race to the
Scotland Highlands, from our favorite neighborhood tea cafe to the
Last year we ran a kickstarter to launch our first two bags: the
Journeyman Commuter and the Lillium Side-purse. The response was
fantastic and the rave reviews speak for themselves. Here's just a few:
ask you: is there a better feeling than when someone says, ""awesome
bag! Looks like something Indiana Jones would use."" Of course there
""I got this bag for my significant other and he loves it. Beautiful leather and craftsmanship- he uses it every day."" -Caitlyn F.
think these bags find the perfect balance between professional and
casual. I take mine to work everyday. It fits my 15 inch laptop
perfectly, and fits snugly enough that it doesn't get in the way during
my train commute. Worth every penny."" -Chris B.
got this bag for my trip over the pond, but since I've been back home, I
haven't wanted to give it up, so I'm using it every day. And, I just
bought a 2nd one, to be sure that I have a backup in case something
happens to mine and I can't replace it!"" -Linda C.
""Finest leather, perfect work, great design. The Lillium won’t be the last Intrepid stuff I buy, for sure!"" -Roland M.
we haven’t stopped there! After many hours of design and many many
prototypes, our new line of products takes everything we learned from
our first two bags and rolls them into a brand new lineup.
Each and every item is made by hand, the old-fashioned way, by
craftsman who have been doing this for generations. Constructed from the
highest quality materials in the world, and designed without
compromise. The end results are conscientiously made, artfully crafted,
heirloom quality products for modern day explorers and adventurers.
July: Finalize prototypes, create gold samples, order dies
August: Order materials and begin production on products
September: Continue production and quality control inspections
As crowdfunding veterans with 2 years of business under our belt, we
have many of the risks and challenges very well mitigated. We have also
partnered again with Brian Holmes of Pad & Quill who brings his
extensive product development, manufacturing, and delivering experience
into play to help ensure everything runs smoothly.
Of course, when having products made by hand there is always the risk
that things might take a little longer than expected. Slight delays may
happen since multiple suppliers are involved in sourcing materials and
getting things set up. That is the biggest risk we face.
We are committed to keeping our products to the highest standards and
have multiple levels of quality assurance checks to make sure that each
and every bag is the highest of quality before we ship. We will not
ship a single inferior product, that is our promise to you.",44.0,0,"1 Campaign
